story:
Etiquette 4 Lucid Dreaming (E4LD)

E4LD is an art project created by The Other Theatre (1) selected for the 2013 season of the New York-based, non-profit organization Project for Empty Space. (2) It consists of two parts: a series of in situ-participative-performance-installations taking place in the Spring, one at the Ideas City Festival of the New Museum; and a series of public outdoor film screenings taking place in the Fall - both in New York City.

E4LD is a hybrid project mixing theatre, architecture and cinema. It invites the public into an empty space, gives them mp3 players, and asks them to create a performance based on the choreographic instructions that they hear. Duos, groups and individuals move, dance, interact. During the piece, the public is filmed, creating yet another interpretation of the experience.

The piece explores the use of mp3 players as a tool for organizing territory, time and the boundaries of the body in public space. It challenges our concept of the traditional and «comfortable» dynamic of the spectator-performer relationship and at the same time, asks us to look at how architectural space influences our capacity for heroic and personal expression.

By using the mp3 players, the audio experience is transformed into both an internal and external theatrical experience. The participant -not the play or the technology- is the art.

The soundscapes heard on the mp3 players have two main components: the movement instructions (choreography) as well as music and text (the story). These components are directly inspired by the location where the installation takes place.

Previously, three versions of the project have taken place in Montreal, entitled: Afterlife (2008), Spiral Jetty (2009), and Home Theatre (2011).

E4LD encapsulates and extends these past experiences into a richer and more complex edition.

Your donation will help us create the piece, create the films and bring it all to NYC!

 

E4LD Creators:  Stacey Christodoulou, Enrique Enriquez, Tamara Scherbak

Project for Empty Space Founders and Curators: Jasmine Wahi and Meenakshi Thirukode

 

For more information, you can write to us at: e4ldnewyork@gmail.com

 

(1)    For more information of The Other Theatre please visit:

http://othertheatre.com/.

(2)    For more information of Project for Empty Space please visit:

www.projectforemptyspace.org.

 

For further updates ‘like’ us on Facebook and follow us at:

https://www.facebook.com/othertheatre

https://www.facebook.com/PForEmptySpace?fref=ts

 

Thanks!

The Other Theatre

story:
THE "I AM YOUR ONE WAY TICKET" ART T-SHIRT PROJECT

 

I've always been interested in screenprinting my own tshirts with custom designs created from fragments of my own artwork. This is the fruition of that idea, but there's one problem - it's costly to get a quality product screenprinted as an independant artist.

With your support, I will be doing a small size run of t-shirts in both men's and women's cuts. This is also your opportunity to take advantage of being one of the first people to get one of these shirts. There are also some amazing perks available for those who love my original pieces as well. All of my perks and the original design for this shirt come from the in-progress series, Dream Fevers, more of which can be viewed through my Facebook page.

This particular project will help fund an artist from the small city of Nanaimo on Vancouver Island, support the local businesses and help share art with the world. Like the design? Consider donating and being a part of something that will make my heart smile!

For a complete look at my portfolio, please visit www.jessicamolcan.com.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

FUNDS
I have set a goal for this fundraising campaign at an amount that would cover costs associated with screenprinting and shipping the shirts, as well as fulfilling some of the perks. The quality of product I'm looking for isn't cheap, but the more shirts I run, the less expensive it gets. If I were to go over my fundraising goal, I would increase the amount of shirts produced, as well as the quanity of the t-shirt perks, adding some additional art goodies as well. Reaching my goal will also open the door to producing more art shirts and a variety of designs incorporating my own artwork - this is what my long term goal with this would be in getting the venture off it's feet.

I decided the best way to go about handling this particular project is with fixed funding - this means if I can't get the project funded completely, no one is out money and the t-shirts will have to wait to come to fruition some other time. I also chose IndieGoGo because it opens up my project to a broader audience, gives the world an idea of what I'm capable of, and takes care of the financial management of the project if I don't hit my goal.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

ABOUT THE DESIGN
The design is based off the original piece, "I am your one way ticket". Halfway through the creation of the piece, I scanned it into Adobe Photoshop and finished it through digital painting. The design has been on quite a journey since then. Having a few shots at being printed, but none panning out, I finally decided to take the matter into my own hands. 

Above: The original "I am your one way ticket" piece, available as a print {left} and the final "I am your one way ticket" design {right}

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

SO ABOUT THESE T-SHIRTS...

  • Classic white
  • Men and women's style v-neck shirts
  • Soft fabric
  • Long lasting ink that's properly cured, making the design last longer than the shirt itself
  • Supporting a local screenprinting business here in Nanaimo
  • A quality product
  • A full size selection from S-2XL

 

 

Above: Men's shirt mockup

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

 

PERKS

All perks will be shipped mid-to-late March, as the campaign finishes on March 15th. The bigger the perk, the longer the arrival. Everyone will receive their perks by the end of April.

Thank-You Perk: The Thank-You Perk package comes with a handmade thank you card with a heartfelt note, and some art goodies to keep for yourself, as well as a limited edition mini print that is signed and numbered.

The BOGO Perk: In this package, I'm offering an unframed, signed and numbered small print on lightweight watercolour paper along with the shirt in your size (or whichever size and style you'd like). The print will be from my Dream Fevers collection, This package includes the Thank-You Perk. 

The Perks with Original Pieces: The Double-Up Perks, the Large Art Perks, and the XL Art Perk all come with original pieces. These are a steal and the best value if you love my art or my style. The Double-Up and Large Art Perks contain never-before-seen pieces that will be released for viewing halfway through the campaign. The XL Art Perk has a predetermined size - but the content is up to you. If you take a look at the collection thus far via Facebook, you can see the style of commission. I can work from a photo, a loose concept, or you are free just to leave it up to me. The XL Art perk also contained a framed, limited edition signed print of "I am your one way ticket".

Above: An example from Dream Fevers called Emotional Overconsumption, and will also be the art print for the BOGO Perk

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

ABOUT JESSICA
Jessica Molčan is in her twenties and resides on the west coast of Canada on beautiful Vancouver Island. After completing her Bachelor's degree in English Literature and Visual Art, Jessica has continued to pursue her artistic endeavours as both a freelance illustrator/designer, and a practising visual artist, booking shows and selling pieces. Her inspiration is derived from her subconscious, fears and hopes, observations and the world around her. Jessica is continually striving to better herself and skill set as an artist.

Her pieces each contain their own haunted preservation of memory and can be read a variety of ways. Fascinated with the push and pull reaction, Jessica attempts to make her audience uncomfortable while still presenting a thing of beauty. This reaction has been consistent among Jessica's showings, and is especially true of the pieces most visceral, ominous and disturbing. It is the chase of this reaction that helps Jessica to keep evolving as an artist.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

SHIPPING
Shipping costs are included in the perk amounts (as a courtesy, please add $5 for those outside North America). As long as everything goes smoothly, I'm anticipating all perks will be delivered by April.

Above: Women's shirt mockup

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

SHARING
I understand times are tight so if you aren't able to contribute funds at this time, please consider spreading the word about my project via the many sharing tools Indiegogo provides here.

I would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone in advance for their support of my campaign. If you have any other questions, I'm welcome to them and don't hesitate to ask.

story:
A Little About Me:

  • I am currently a Studio Art major at UNCG, with a diehard passion for photography and I will be graduating in the Fall of 2013. I live and breath art and photography. For me, there is no greater feeling than that of creation. It was very easy for me then to get into art at a very early age. I have worked ever since I was 16 and have always supported myself monetarily, and now support myself by working towards paying bills as a 21 year old on my own. A strong work ethic coupled with an extreme passion for making art has led me to where I am today and it is my hope in life to pass down this passion for art to my future children, and to as many other people as possible. 

Where Will Money Go?:

  • Every dime raised towards the cause will be put towards purchasing photography equipment to kickstart my career in commercial photography. The money will be put towards studio lighting and set up, as well as any camera equipment needed.
  • Those that donate will get a 25% discount on any future photoshoots, as well as a framed 8" x 10" print of their choosing. Remember, the donations you provide will come back to you full circle through my photography!

The Impact of Your Generous Donations:

  • Recently my photography career has gained momentum. My work will be featured in the upcoming Coraddi, a school-wde arts and literature magazine that is published by UNCG. Also, another of my works will be featured at Maya Art Gallery on Tate Street in Greensboro, NC. With your donation, I will continue to work very hard at what I love so that one day my work and passion for what I do will spread even farther. 

Other Ways You Can Help Contribute:

  • If you cannot contribute monetarily, that's okay! Please share with your friends and family and encourage them to donate.

story:
After a number of faithful years of 24/7 service, Cynosure Radio's base broadcast machine has played it's last tune.  Not much to say other than there was a series of sounds,  there was a smell like burnt popcorn,  then there was nothing.  

 

While bearing the bulk of the financial weight to return Cynosure Radio to 24/7 operation, we are looking to partner with YOU to ease a percentage of the cost. 

Just imagine me with risers behind me filled with people on phones....

 

Now imagine me at your childs dedication as their Godfather.....there. See? That's nice.  A valued member of the family.  Thats what Cynosure Radio has always been.  We love you.

 

This service requires that we ask a minimum of $500 for the project.  Do not let that number intimidate.  We have set the project for flexible funding.  Any amount donated will be recieved and match our contributions toward the new equipment.

 

Finally, in the interest of keeping you in the know about your investment, we will be looking to replace the failed piece with quality budget equipment.  This will not be used as an opportunity to upgrade, merely to remain serving as we have in the past.

 

Thanks.
story_txt:
After a number of faithful years of 24/7 service, Cynosure Radio's base broadcast machine has played it's last tune.  Not much to say other than there was a series of sounds,  there was a smell like burnt popcorn,  then there was nothing.  
 
While bearing the bulk of the financial weight to return Cynosure Radio to 24/7 operation, we are looking to partner with YOU to ease a percentage of the cost.  
Just imagine me with risers behind me filled with people on phones....
 
Now imagine me at your childs dedication as their Godfather.....there. See? That's nice.  A valued member of the family.  Thats what Cynosure Radio has always been.  We love you.
 
This service requires that we ask a minimum of $500 for the project.  Do not let that number intimidate.  We have set the project for flexible funding.  Any amount donated will be recieved and match our contributions toward the new equipment.
 
Finally, in the interest of keeping you in the know about your investment, we will be looking to replace the failed piece with quality budget equipment.  This will not be used as an opportunity to upgrade, merely to remain serving as we have in the past.
 
Thanks.

story:
Who we are?

ATAC, was created in May 2011, the Tunisian Association of movement for the Cinema defends "the free cinema" and the requirements of its development. ATAC is looking for reconnecting the citizen with cinema and contributing at the recast of the Tunisian cinematographic sector.

What is our project?

Our project "Mobile Cinema" is inspired by the fairground and circus atmosphere that roamed rural areas. Such event contributes in bringing joy and festivity among villagers.
The action consists basically of a cycle of mobile screenings that takes place every year covering a big part of the Tunisian territory, especially the rural regions where citizens are disadvantaged from simple means of cultural entertainment. The screenings are free and take place in open and public places where everyone can have access to it. Generally the idea that we want to deliver is that public spaces can become an asset for all citizens and a place where they can freely express and talk their mind.
Why it is important?

This event represents a substantial value for us as it contributes in bringing joy and delight for children who have never got the chance to see a movie on a big screen before. Such event helps children and people to share artistic moments by exposing art especially cinema. Also it can be a tool to discover their hidden talents.
We are acting in a space where everyone from all over the world can contribute to present the cinema and its forms to these destitute people. As human beings we deeply believe that everyone can draw a smile on children's faces with the simplest means available. 

Since we are a committed organization we defined a list of objectives that we want to reach from this project.

1. Reborn the concept of circus and troubadour wanderers, in order to revive these old customs.

2. Accessibility for children and teens to image through the primitive photographic tool (Pinhole) and its practice.

3. Make beneficiaries discover other arts disciplines (Shadow Theater and Tales).

4. Decentralize the access to Cinema and take it to citizens in rural villages.

5. Install a space of discussion for children to make them understand the films. 


The budget we need

To achieve our project, we need 45000 US dollars

Renting audiovisual and technical equipments: 9.900

Costs of the theatrical shows: 3.700

Costs of the pinhole workshops:  3.000

Audiovisual Archiving: 4.500

Printing: 1.500

Movies Copyright:  1.900

Transport Fees (equipments and team):  4.400

Accommodation and Catering: 5,600

Insurance: 2.000

Salaries of the working Team: 8.500

Total: 45.000

where the funds will go if we do not fully reach our goal:

Even  if we won't reach fully our goal we will do our best to complet our action with the available means that we have. We are extremly commited to bring cinema to people's heart and be a part of the change that event will bring.

The impact

The Mobile cinema is a new genre of media and is fundamentally different from conventional Storytelling media, such as web, TV, radio. We believe that this type of events has an intense value.

The mobile cinema provides a mixed reality story presentation that is able to offer a sense of authenticity that comes from ambient awareness, the movement of the audience's body, and depicted story events that were often recorded at the location where they appear. In designing mobile cinema, we are looking to design a cinematographic story experience that plays out in small fragments over time in response to how the audience walks around a location, move through the space along different paths and engage in different aspects of the physical environment.

This concept of mobile cinema is entirely new; People who can't havee access to cinema the cinema will go to them and by this, disadvantaged people will be able to enjoy this opportunity that their social situation deprived them from enjoying it.

Such important event that is still considered as a trend will keep spreading to touch other regions until it reaches the whole country, why not the rural areas all over the world.

Most importantly contributors’ role must not be forgotten as they are the backbone of the event and without them we wouldn’t be able to fulfill our goals. Also such contribution will increase their spiritual values as they helped disadvantaged people to have a liftime opportunity to discover such magic; the magic of seeing a film on a big screen.

Our organization fulfilled this event the 2 last years and it was able to reach people in many rural isolated areas. The impact of the event was really impressive and people who were part of the experience really enjoyed it and had an opportunity to really feel and see what mobile cinema is. That’s why we want people to believe in us and trust us as a nonprofit organization that aims to bring joy and happiness to people who suffer a lot in their daily life and we really aim on taking a part of that sadness and replace with something pure and happy.

Otherways to find support:

Financial contribution may not be the only way to assit us in the realization of such project, but there exist also other forms of support.
If you believe in this project and if you believe in the fact that the right to cultutre is global specially to cinema and think that it is a fundamental right, then do not hesitate to give us your support.

Morover if you believe in the fact that every child, citizen, not only in tunisia but everywhere in the world has the right to watch a movie on a big screen, do not hesitate to share this project with your friends, and spread it on your networks. Through this you will help us bring the magic of cinema to the citizens that are deprived from their right to the image and culture.

story:
We are a group of artists participating in a network called INTAC (International Art Collaborations). This network is allowing those of us at OCAD University in Toronto, Canada to create collaborative artworks with partner universities in South Korea, India, Germany, Japan and Finland. We work primarily with photography and our overarching theme for the year is Desire: The Double Edged Sword. 


Each year we curate a culminating exhibition to show our final collection of works. This year we have been given the opportunity to install our exhibition in Tampere, Finland AND Toronto, Canada.

Although installing two shows of this scale is an incredibly exciting and welcomed opportunity, the printing and organizing of these events will be a costly endeavour. We have therefore organized this Indiegogo campaign to offset some of installation and travel expenses associated with this project while giving you, the contributors, a chance to own some exclusive art made by some of the talented artists that together make up the INTAC collective. 


Your contributions will directly aid in realizing exhibitions that will feature a passionate international group of artists. 

As this campaign is run by the students of OCAD University, all collected funds will go directly to the artists and will be spent on the following:

  • printing and installing artwork in Toronto
  • offsetting travel expenses en route to Finland
  • production and printing of promotional materials (posters/catalogues etc.)


Maddie Alexander, Chicago, Digital Inkjet Print, 13" x 19", 2014. Edition of 5.

Maddie Alexander is a Canadian artist studying and working in Toronto, Ontario. They began their education studying at NSCAD University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, and are now in their final year at OCAD University to graduate with a BFA in Photography. Their work explores multiple themes including the female bodies' presence in our history and society, addressing the stigmatization of mental illness in our society, and LGBPTTQQIIAA+ issues. Mainly through portraiture and combining text and image, they enjoy working experimentally by integrating multidisciplinary practices. 

www.maddie-alexander.com

Giselle Mira Diaz, Untitled, Digital Inkjet Print, 13" x 19", 2015. Edition of 10.

Giselle Mira Diaz is a Toronto based Photographer and Visual Artist, from Colombian decent. She is currently completing a bachelor in Fine Arts in Integrated Media and a minor in Photography at OCAD University, and a concentration on Photographic Techniques at Humber College. Her work is mainly oriented towards film and digital photography but also does performance art. Through her art Giselle is interested in defining self-identity, heritage, and the hybrid cultures as the product of the multicultural interaction in cosmopolitan cities.

www.gisellemiradiaz.com

 

Antonio Giacchetti, Mark #23, Digital Inkjet Print, 19.75" x 27.5", 2014. Edition of 10.

Antonio Giacchetti is a visual artist based in Southern Ontario, currently completing a BFA in Photography at OCAD University. His practice includes a variety of experimental image making methods, conceptual and studio based photography as well as short performative and experimental films. Recent works have explored deconstructions of the photographic image, mark-making, and notions of home, memory, and formative experiences from the context of the male form.


www.antoniogiacchetti.com

Jesse King, Strangers, Digital Inkjet Print, 24" x 24", 2016. Edition of 10.

Jesse King is an emerging Aboriginal artist based in Toronto, Canada. He is currently completing an undergraduate photography degree at OCAD University. His work frequently explores the many facets of identity, including discussions of queerness, gender, and the importance of cultural representation and how artwork is so closely tied to the very core of culture. Jesse’s work has been exhibited internationally in Berlin, Germany and has been printed in several independent publications. 


www.jesseking.format.com

 

Laura Mitchell, Untitled, Handmade jewellery*, 2015. One of a kind.

Laura Mitchell is a Toronto based jeweller, artist and designer. Her work is mainly inspired by nature and travel. She uses a variety of materials such as metal, wood and textiles. Her work has been shown in Canada and Germany.

www.lauramitchelldesigns.wordpress.com
*detailed descriptions in perk listings


Farihah Shah, What Remains, Digital Inkjet Print, 28" x 35", 2015. Edition of 1.

Farihah Shah is a Toronto and Bradford-Based artist originally from Edmonton, Alberta.  Her work explores issues of racial identity, constructed landscapes, personal and collective memory, and the ebb and flow of people in private and public spaces through photography, performance and film. She has participated in exhibitions in Canada and Germany.


www.fshah.format.com

Sid Tangerine, X/Y, Digital Inkjet Print on Watercolour Paper, 16" x 16". 2015. Edition of 5.

Sid Tangerine is a multimedia artist and musician based in Toronto, Canada. Through multiple processes of medium exploration, Tangerine’s works are realized in experimental sonic arts, performance arts and video installations. His recent practice focuses on a minimalist approach dealing with subjects of time, space and distance. Tangerine performs as OS/MOS, a sound collective formed with his collaborator Brian Pierce. While experimenting different sonic possibilities and collaborating with likeminded artists for various projects, the duo expects to release a LP in Fall 2016.
www.instagram.com/sid_tangerine

Victoria Wojtan, Crystal Bullets, Handmade Jewellery*, 2016. Each piece unique.

Victoria Wojtan is an artist based in Toronto, currently finishing her final year at OCAD University. Mostly working in analogue, her work explores themes of intimacy, vulnerability, the subconscious and human psyche, as well as the connections and disconnect humans have with their surroundings. She also deals with the female gaze and the performance of self, delving into her own experiences as a queer woman and her relationships with those around her whom she photographs.

www.victoriawojtan.format.com

*detailed descriptions in perk listings


In addition to the above listed works, we are also offering a "Grab Bag" filled with your choice of miscellaneous prints made by members of the collective.


1. Antonio Giacchetti, Lake Erie, Digital Inkjet Print, 8" x 10", 2015
2. Farihah Shah, In The Valley, Digital Inkjet Print, 5" x 7", 2015.
3. Giselle Mira Diaz, Untitled, Digital Inkjet Print, 11" x 17", 2015
4. Sabrina Leeder, Untitled, Digital Inkjet Print, 11.5" x 14" ,2015
5. Benny Hunter, Untitled, Digital Inkjet Print, 11" x 14", 2015
6. Antonio Giacchetti, Loki, Digital Inkjet Print, 8" x 10", 2015
7. Jesse King, Strangers, Digital Inkjet Print, 12" x 12", 2016
8. Giselle Mira Diaz, Untitled, Digital Inkjet Print, 11" x 17", 2015
9. Maddie Alexander, Chicago, Digital Inkjet Print, 13" x 19", 2014



Reclaim Desire // Rewrite Pornographies, 52 page colour publication, 5.5" x 8.5", 2016.

'Reclaim Desire // Rewrite Pornographies' is a zine featuring photographic art and essays that reflect on the way in which pornography has become the dominant means of sexual education within social culture and the resultant effect on desire. This 52-page high-quality colour print zine features work by 6 artists from Korea, Finland, Germany and Canada complete with artist's manifesto and editor's introduction.


 

We believe that INTAC represents far more than international opportunities for emerging artists. With the help of your contributions, you will be directly supporting a program that allows us an opportunity to learn and experience new ways of being, seeing and making. Thanks to INTAC, we have been exposed to artworks and fellow artists from around the world. We came together to create a body of collective works that visualize a discussion that began only a few short years ago. This discussion dissolves the barriers of language, time, race, and geography and opens the door to even more collaborative connections and friendships that have evidently harboured a deeply fertile creative environment that now spans a vast global network.

Thank you dearly for your contribution, and we hope to see you at the exhibition!




*Disclaimer*

Shipping and delivery dates of donation perks are currently undetermined but are estimated to be printed/packaged and sent out following the production and installation of the aforementioned exhibitions.
Some time sensitive perks (including Postcard from Finland), will be produced and mailed no earlier than the 20th of April 2016.

story:
Short Summary

High energy and Burning Man go hand-in-hand! The firing of Sextant's Tesla coils will bring electrifying entertainment to Black Rock City. First invented in 1891 by Nikola Tesla, these coils are electrical resonant transformer circuits that produce high-voltage, low-current, high frequency alternating-current electricity that looks like lightning from across the Playa. To see these coils in action is to witness an amazing feat of science and engineering. Please help our sparks fly on the Playa by joining our campaign!


What We Need & What You Get

To build, transport, and fire our Tesla coils on the Playa will cost approximately $15,000.

The breakdown of these costs are:

$500 buys the raw materials for the High-Current Circuit

$500 covers the cost to water-jet the plates for the High-Current Circuit

$500 covers the new High-Current Transformer

$1000 buys raw materials for the Spark Gap

$1500 covers transportation expenses to move the coils from Oakland, CA to Black Rock City, NV

$2500 covers the Rolling Circuit Assembly Cart to house the electronics

$3500 buys the new custom Capacitor Bank

$5000 covers the twin custom-built High-Voltage Inductors


To thank you for your support, Sextant offers some unique perks. Please visit our perks page to choose among them!

All funds raised will go to the creation, maintenance, and operation of the Tesla coils ongoing. We hope to exceed our goal to support these efforts for many years to come, both by bringing them back to Black Rock City each year and by demonstrating them at schools and museums in the greater Bay Area during the rest of the year.


The Impact

Tesla coils are science. Tesla coils are art. Mingled with the lights, sights, and sounds of Black Rock City, the interplay of our coupled Tesla coils will provide electrifying entertainment nightly on our Playa. Our sparks will be beacons throughout the night sky, bringing burners together to witness a lightning show like no other.


Risks & Challenges

In the past, Sextant has relied on an all solid-state "ultra-high resonant gain" Tesla Coil circuit. This design is remarkably efficient, but we found unexpected Corona Loss on our Toroids which was enough to severely limit the Spark output. In a last-ditch effort to bring sparks to the Playa, we over-drove the current by 7x to power through most of the Corona Loss. For those of you who witnessed the explosion on-Playa last year, we hope you soaked up as much of the entertainment value as we did. We figure this, the third installment, MUST spark as advertised, so we are using a traditional Spark Gap circuit design for the 2016 cycle. We are able to predict the performance of this system much more accurately, and we are in good shape to bring epic 24 ft sparks upon you all. Stay tuned for future editions of the circuit as we return to Solid State with minimized Corona Loss and are able to finally achieve one of the original goals: ultra high-fidelity plasma sound!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! If you want to see sparks fly at Burning Man, please help us to make some noise about our campaign by spreading the word. There are tools for sharing right here on Indiegogo, and we urge you to "like" the Sextant Camp Facebook page as well to stay up-to-date on the coils' progress.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
High energy and Burning Man go hand-in-hand! The firing of Sextant's Tesla coils will bring electrifying entertainment to Black Rock City. First invented in 1891 by Nikola Tesla, these coils are electrical resonant transformer circuits that produce high-voltage, low-current, high frequency alternating-current electricity that looks like lightning from across the Playa. To see these coils in action is to witness an amazing feat of science and engineering. Please help our sparks fly on the Playa by joining our campaign!

   What We Need & What You Get 
To build, transport, and fire our Tesla coils on the Playa will cost approximately $15,000. 
The breakdown of these costs are:
$500 buys the raw materials for the High-Current Circuit
$500 covers the cost to water-jet the plates for the High-Current Circuit
$500 covers the new High-Current Transformer
$1000 buys raw materials for the Spark Gap
$1500 covers transportation expenses to move the coils from Oakland, CA to Black Rock City, NV
$2500 covers the Rolling Circuit Assembly Cart to house the electronics
$3500 buys the new custom Capacitor Bank
$5000 covers the twin custom-built High-Voltage Inductors
To thank you for your support, Sextant offers some unique perks. Please visit our perks page to choose among them!
All funds raised will go to the creation, maintenance, and operation of the Tesla coils ongoing. We hope to exceed our goal to support these efforts for many years to come, both by bringing them back to Black Rock City each year and by demonstrating them at schools and museums in the greater Bay Area during the rest of the year. 
   The Impact

Tesla coils are science. Tesla coils are art. Mingled with the lights, sights, and sounds of Black Rock City, the interplay of our coupled Tesla coils will provide electrifying entertainment nightly on our Playa. Our sparks will be beacons throughout the night sky, bringing burners together to witness a lightning show like no other. 
Risks & Challenges


In the past, Sextant has relied on an all solid-state "ultra-high resonant gain" Tesla Coil circuit. This design is remarkably efficient, but we found unexpected Corona Loss on our Toroids which was enough to severely limit the Spark output. In a last-ditch effort to bring sparks to the Playa, we over-drove the current by 7x to power through most of the Corona Loss. For those of you who witnessed the explosion on-Playa last year, we hope you soaked up as much of the entertainment value as we did. We figure this, the third installment, MUST spark as advertised, so we are using a traditional Spark Gap circuit design for the 2016 cycle. We are able to predict the performance of this system much more accurately, and we are in good shape to bring epic 24 ft sparks upon you all. Stay tuned for future editions of the circuit as we return to Solid State with minimized Corona Loss and are able to finally achieve one of the original goals: ultra high-fidelity plasma sound!

  Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! If you want to see sparks fly at Burning Man, please help us to make some noise about our campaign by spreading the word. There are tools for sharing right here on Indiegogo, and we urge you to "like" the Sextant Camp Facebook page as well to stay up-to-date on the coils' progress.

story:
What's our deal?

We're a collective of Boston-based zine-lovers who are resurrecting the annual Boston Zine Fest! We will be holding the first Boston Zine Fest in 6 years, this October on the 11th & 12th. We want this event to be huge, and already have tablers from all across the U.S. and Canada!

 In order to make this dream a reality, we need to raise $1,500 for our venue, food on the day of the event, printing/creating promotional materials, & providing for accessibility needs.

The BZF collective prides itself on striving to create a free, open-to-the-public, safer space, for zine creators and appreciators world wide to come together and exchange ideas, skills, and of course, zines! We are a not-for-profit collective whose primary focuses are promoting zine culture, and encouraging inclusivity within zine culture of individuals of all genders, races, sexualities, sizes, and abilities.

*All proceeds go towards the 2014 Boston Zine Fest, as well as ensuring that the BZF remains an annual event*


What's in it for you?

Help us put Boston back on the map as a major zine-city!
Encourage the creative cut-n'-paster in us all to keep on keepin' on!
Encourage & support DIY culture in the Greater Boston Area!

And of course, there are tangible incentives for donating to BZF such as
zines, artwork, BZF merch, gift-cards to local vendors, & much more to be announced in coming weeks.

PLEASE NOTE: *Orders that will not be picked up at the 2014 BZF will have to pay additional shipping.*

How else can you get involved?

Spread the word by sharing our IndieGoGo, Facebook, & webpage on your social media!
Attend a fundraiser!
Become a volunteer!
Apply to table!
& last but certainly not least, come hangout with us at the 2014 Boston Zine Fest on October 11th & 12th!

story:
Hello!

I'm Charlene Hamilton, and I'm a Birthing From Within  Mentor and artist living in the Seattle, WA metro area. I've been drawing since I could hold a crayon, and I've been working in childbirth education for over a decade. 

A labor and birth colouring book?

Adults have suddenly discovered that they can use colouring books; for relaxation, creative expression, and just for fun. I wanted to take the concept of an adult colouring book, and use it to show the beauty, power and grace of the birthing woman.  Throw in some of my favorite quotes about birth, and you have a colouring book that can be a personal art project, or a childbirth class activity. 

  • 15+ pages of full page art
  • Single sided card stock
  • Spiral bound for easier coloring
  • Art released under Creative Commons licencing*

What Gets Funded? 

This campaign raises money to allow me to get a whole bunch of copies of the book made, and then get those books out to into the world. $500 is a whole lot of copies, but that's IGG's minimum :) 

So it will go towards printing and shipping costs, mostly- including those people who order their books through this campaign.  After this campaign is done, the book will be available to order on my website, and I'd like to have a stock available to mail out, instead of having to run to the printer's every time :) 

What Needs Done? 

The artwork for the book is done, it is now being transfered into a digital format, and layout on the pages has started. Since I'm doing this mostly myself, I'm budgeting in time for holidays and other chaos and shooting to have the books printed by February. If this is successful well over the campaign amount, I may have the funds to have the artwork completely re-inked digitally, and that would make things happen faster. 

This campaign is done as flexible funding- meaning I receive whatever money is raised in 30 days, even if it doesn't reach the full goal, and anyone who ordered a book will get one. 

Yes, shipping internationally is expensive. No, I don't like it either. I wish I didn't have to charge an arm and a leg for international shipping, but if I didn't I wouldn't be able to ship outside of the US. (For a quick example- a test postage calculation to the UK was $16. So in many cases I'll be paying more for shipping than I'm actually charging.)

* Permission will be granted for copying pages for personal, classroom & clinic use, as long as full credit is given, and the pages are not redistributed for commercial purpose.

story:
Who we are 

Jessie Chappe & Blake C. Hollaway met earlier this year and had an idea for a new type of fashion film. An innovative way to tell a beautiful, heartbreaking story about demons of our past, that hasn't been told before. From this idea, and meeting Finnius R. Morrisley, FRM Productions was born. 

 

                                       

Blake C. Hollaway

Forever attracted to all forms of storytelling, Blake began her career as a writer and an actress. At age 15 she moved to New York City to attend the New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts. In New York, she attended film classes in which the students learned by fulfilling a specific job on set during each class. This piqued her interest in working on the other side of the camera, but it was not until landing a leading role in Producer/Director Robinson Vil's feature film Life.less that Blake really fell in love with the art of filmmaking. Inspired by Robinson Vil's work and with his help as a mentor, Blake went on to open her first production company. Over the course of several years, she worked on various projects on the east coast. After making the big move to Los Angeles a little over a year ago, her focus has mainly been writing, directing, and producing. FRM will be her first LA based production company. With help from her partners Jessie Chappe and Finnius R. Morrissley, she hopes to continue to create circles of work for people in the industry and tell unique stories that invoke conversation. Fun fact about Blake: There is a lot of hidden symbols and imagery in her works that have helped give her a very specific style over the years. 

Jessie Chappe

A recent LA Transplant from Chicago. Jessie got her BFA in Playwriting from Cornish College of the Arts. Since college, she has been writing her way across the country. She has been working in casting since graduation, which is what brought her to LA a little over a year ago. She focuses her writing on intimate relationships that explore the human experience. Since arriving in LA, her dream has been to make movies that invoke conversations, move people, and inspire others to go out and follow their dreams. Here's a fun picture that is not candid at all but looks like it might be! Fun fact about Jessie: she collects the handwriting of people she loves and tattoos them on her body in her favorite quotes from movies and books that best represent that person. 

                                    

Finnius R. Morrissley

Finnius' background is still a mystery to most. We are still waiting on him to submit his official bio. As he is terribly camera shy and afraid of the spotlight, we might never get it ;) 

 

Why we're here

We are looking to raise at least $5000 to bring the visionary world of The Dark Prince to life.

$5000 is a TEENY amount of money for a film...even a short film. Even film budgets with 1 million dollars are considered low budget in this industry! We know $5000 seems like a lot for a short film - but we have to pay our talented artists. We have a team willing to work for little- because that's how much our team believes in the vision of The Dark Prince. The producers, Jessie & Blake, will not be taking any of that money as payment. All the money will be going towards paying our crew, paying our actors, and renting equipment needed to shoot. We believe everyone deserves to get paid for their work. We only hire the best, and know that in order to do that, we need to meet our minimum goal of $5000.

 As FRM's first fashion film production, we are hoping to start off with a bang. We have almost everything we need: an innovative script, a talented cast, a group of passionate filmmakers ...all that's left is the funding to bring our vision to life. Once completed, we will be competing in film festivals all around the world. We know that The Dark Prince is just the beginning of FRM. We can't wait to show you what we can bring to the big screen.

FRM is dedicated to bringing intimate stories of relationships to life on the screen through visionary filmmaking and original stories. We have found this group of artists in LA who can't wait to work on films that speak about the human experience.

What makes us so unique is our dedication to making the entire process of filmmaking a collaboration between all the artists involved. We strive to bring out the best in each other, and have found that through collaboration. 

 

Budget

Here's where your contribution will be going:

                 

*Expendables are random out of pocket production expenses such as the very expensive hard drives that are necessary for editing. 

Challenges:

Since we are a new company, we aren't shy to let you know that we need the help from the rest of the community. Not just filmmakers and artists, but everyone who loves to discover new ways of telling/seeing stories. 

Right now our biggest challenge is raising the funds for our production needs. We have the right team. We just need the funds. We know that once completed, The Dark Prince will be a tough competitor in the film festival circuit. We truly believe that the success of The Dark Prince will further the progress for the future of FRM Productions.

 

The Rest of the Team

Finnius R. Morrissley - Executive Producer

Jessie Chappe - Executive Producer/Writer

Blake C. Hollaway - Director/Executive Producer/Writer

Jennifer Hancock - Line Producer

Robert LaMantia - Director of Photography/Editor

Victor Helidor - The Dark Prince 

Luke Pensabene - Ethan

 

Donating is the first step

Help us spread the word! These days social media is a great medium to do this! Follow FRM at @FinniusRMorrissley on Instagram and take a look at the behind the scenes! We want the world to know about us and our project! Every voice matters, and we appreciate all the help we can get to reach as many people as possible!

story:
The Vision of Andrew Christian

When I first started this book eight months ago, I had no idea how important and relevant it was going to be after the recent Presidential election.  

This book isn't just sexy photos...it explains that SEX is more than SEX...it's power, it's emotion, it's creation, it's personal expression, it's political freedom...it's HAPPINESS.

Creating this art and coffee table book has been an endeavor into bringing positive awareness about LGBT empowerment as it relates to political freedom in the USA and around the world.  This book features the Andrew Christian Trophy Boy models pushing the limits of sexual desires and what that means for everyone in modern society. 

The Project

Making this book into a reality has been an experience, to say the least. With the ever growing Andrew Christian image and the many Trophy Boy's involved we want to make sure that this art book will be visible around the world to further visibility of the LGBTI cause.  

Your contribution will allow us the opportunity to ensure that we are able make the ultimate Andrew Christian fan's fantasies spring to life...while, most importantly, doing something good for the world.

The book will also be accompanied by collectors t-shirts, tank tops and calendars featuring images from the book.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to making a contribution, we ask you to get the word out about this art book. Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Instagram, and any other ways you can think of. With more recognition, more people will be able to experience our vision of queer and homoerotic art and expression.

Also please send me your feedback of what you would like to see in the book...after-all I want this book to tell all of our stories. 

 

The Vision of Andrew Christian

Andrew Christian is a Los Angeles based fashion designer with a specialization in men's underwear. With global recognition, Andrew has become a gay and human rights ICON in the LGBTI community, making appearances including but not limited to Bravo's The Fashion Show, Oxygen's The Janice Dickinson Modeling Agency, HGTV's House Hunters International and Hunting Vintage along with being featured on Logo as the official "Pit Crew" sponsor for the Emmy Nominated RuPaul's Drag Race.

story:
El Rey de las Sombras es una obra de teatro que nos acerca a la realidad de los niños en situación de calle.

SINOPSIS

Jessica, una estudiante de psicología que se encuentra desarrollando su tesis sobre menores en situación de calle, conoce a Nihar, un joven sin hogar que se encuentra escapando de un ente maligno que podría ser el causante de la desaparición de otros adolescentes. Nihar, quien se encuentra aterrado, ofrece apoyarla en su investigación con la única condición de que lo ayude a escapar de esta criatura. A partir de ese momento, Jessica y su familia se verán inmersos en la tétrica historia de este chico, que pondrá a prueba sus creencias y en riesgo sus vidas.

ACTORES

Henry Sotomayor “Nihar”
Actor titulado en la Escuela Nacional Superior de Arte Dramático. Participo en talleres de interpretación  con José  Sanchís  Sinisterra, Jorge  Eines  y  Fausto Carrillo, Dramaturgia  con Claudia  Sacha y Dirección Teatral con Carlos Acosta  y Diego  la  Hoz. En el año 2010 fue elegido como uno de los actores a representar a la ENSAD en el WORLD FESTIVAL INTERNATIONAL OF SCHOOLS organizado por la ITI-UNESCO realizado por primera vez en el Perú. En teatro ha participado de los siguientes montajes: “Qué hiciste Diego Diaz?”; “Cacúmenes”; “CircoLoop”; “Los Números Reales”; entre otras. Fue Ganador del Primer concurso de Dramaturgia organizado por la ENSAD con la obra “Thais” y recientemente resulto como uno de los ganadores del concurso de dramaturgia organizado por la Municipalidad de Lima con la obra “La Zona Invisible”, próxima a estrenarse. 
 

Lilian Schiappa “Jessica”
Formada en la facultad de artes escénicas de la PUCP en la especialidad de actuación. Ha realizado talleres complementarios de actuación con Alberto Isola, de improvisación con Carol Hernández y de clown con Andrea Pacheco. También ha recibido formación en ballet realizado en la Escuela de Ballet de San Marcos y Terpsicore; danza contemporánea con Marlon Cabellos, Acrobacia y Circo realizado en PowerFit . En teatro ha participado de las producciones “Spring Awakening”; “El Cementerio de Automóviles”; “Dios es un DJ”; “Tantas Cosas por Contar” (próxima a estrenarse); entre otras. Recientemente viene dedicándose a la docencia de teatro para niños en la PUCP y de manera independiente. 

Edgard Linares “Hans”
Realizó estudios de actuación en el Taller de formación actoral – TEFA”, dirigido por Ramón García; en la “Asociación Cultural Diez Talentos”, dirigido por Bruno Odar y en el Taller para Actores dirigido por Alberto Ísola. Ha recibido cursos complementarios en el Reino Unido a través de la “Fundación Masterclass”. Ha participado como actor en las obras “Los Días de Julián Bisbal”, “El Hombre Desnudo y el Hombre de Frag”, “Tus Amigos Nunca te Harían Daño”, “Jugo de Lima”, “Adulterios”, entre otras. En televisión, participó en las producciones “María Emilia”, “Pobre Diabla”, “Gente como uno”, “La Fuerza” y “Mi amor el wachiman 2”. En cine formó parte del elenco de la película “En Busca de Javier” próxima a estrenarse. Junto a Daría Moriano, conforma el colectivo “Umbral Azul”, poniendo en escena “Esquina Peligrosa” (2015) y “El Curioso caso del Cuerno de San Dios” (2016) en calidad de actor y productor.

Belén Lengua “Sara”
Formada en la facultad de artes escénicas de la PUCP en la especialidad de actuación. Ha realizado talleres complementarios de actuación con Alberto Isola, de improvisación con Carol Hernández y de clown con Andrea Pacheco. También ha recibido formación en ballet realizado en la Escuela de Ballet de San Marcos y Terpsicore; danza contemporánea con Marlon Cabellos, Acrobacia y Circo realizado en PowerFit . En teatro ha participado de las producciones “Spring Awakening”; “El Cementerio de Automóviles”; “Dios es un DJ”; “Tantas Cosas por Contar” (próxima a estrenarse); entre otras. Recientemente viene dedicándose a la docencia de teatro para niños en la PUCP y de manera independiente
 

DIRECTOR

Gabriel Rossel
A la fecha ha dirigido 20 montajes, entre puestas en escena de teatro, teatro musical y Teatro Para Niños; como “Rent: el Musical de Broadway”,“La Dieta Eterna”, “Alba y el Mounstruo”;  entre otras. Estudió dirección con Carlos Acosta, dramaturgia en la Asociación Cultural Aranwa y talleres de actuación con Enrique Victoria, Paco Varela y Rafael Sánchez Mena. Fue fundador y director artístico de la Asociación Cultural Broadway Perú. Actualmente se encuentra a cargo de la dirección artística de Meravéllos Teatro.

PRODUCTORA

MERAVELLOS

Somos una productora con 5 años en el medio, encargada de la difusión de proyectos teatrales con el objetivo de brindar los elementos necesarios que amplíen el proceso formativo de los jóvenes y adultos de nuestra sociedad, hasta la actualidad hemos trabajado aproximadamente 15 procesos formativos, entre los cuales destacan “Cabaret”, “Rent”, “Los Miserables”, “El rey León”, “Wicked” etc. Nuestras producciones se caracterizan por unir todos los elementos necesarios para brindar al público un espectáculo de calidad
story_txt: El Rey de las Sombras es una obra de teatro que nos acerca a la realidad de los niños en situación de calle.SINOPSIS Jessica, una estudiante de psicología que se encuentra desarrollando su tesis sobre menores en situación de calle, conoce a Nihar, un joven sin hogar que se encuentra escapando de un ente maligno que podría ser el causante de la desaparición de otros adolescentes. Nihar, quien se encuentra aterrado, ofrece apoyarla en su investigación con la única condición de que lo ayude a escapar de esta criatura. A partir de ese momento, Jessica y su familia se verán inmersos en la tétrica historia de este chico, que pondrá a prueba sus creencias y en riesgo sus vidas.ACTORESHenry Sotomayor “Nihar”Actor titulado en la Escuela Nacional Superior de Arte Dramático. Participo en talleres de interpretación  con José  Sanchís  Sinisterra, Jorge  Eines  y  Fausto Carrillo, Dramaturgia  con Claudia  Sacha y Dirección Teatral con Carlos Acosta  y Diego  la  Hoz. En el año 2010 fue elegido como uno de los actores a representar a la ENSAD en el WORLD FESTIVAL INTERNATIONAL OF SCHOOLS organizado por la ITI-UNESCO realizado por primera vez en el Perú. En teatro ha participado de los siguientes montajes: “Qué hiciste Diego Diaz?”; “Cacúmenes”; “CircoLoop”; “Los Números Reales”; entre otras. Fue Ganador del Primer concurso de Dramaturgia organizado por la ENSAD con la obra “Thais” y recientemente resulto como uno de los ganadores del concurso de dramaturgia organizado por la Municipalidad de Lima con la obra “La Zona Invisible”, próxima a estrenarse.  Lilian Schiappa “Jessica”Formada en la facultad de artes escénicas de la PUCP en la especialidad de actuación. Ha realizado talleres complementarios de actuación con Alberto Isola, de improvisación con Carol Hernández y de clown con Andrea Pacheco. También ha recibido formación en ballet realizado en la Escuela de Ballet de San Marcos y Terpsicore; danza contemporánea con Marlon Cabellos, Acrobacia y Circo realizado en PowerFit . En teatro ha participado de las producciones “Spring Awakening”; “El Cementerio de Automóviles”; “Dios es un DJ”; “Tantas Cosas por Contar” (próxima a estrenarse); entre otras. Recientemente viene dedicándose a la docencia de teatro para niños en la PUCP y de manera independiente. Edgard Linares “Hans”Realizó estudios de actuación en el Taller de formación actoral – TEFA”, dirigido por Ramón García; en la “Asociación Cultural Diez Talentos”, dirigido por Bruno Odar y en el Taller para Actores dirigido por Alberto Ísola. Ha recibido cursos complementarios en el Reino Unido a través de la “Fundación Masterclass”. Ha participado como actor en las obras “Los Días de Julián Bisbal”, “El Hombre Desnudo y el Hombre de Frag”, “Tus Amigos Nunca te Harían Daño”, “Jugo de Lima”, “Adulterios”, entre otras. En televisión, participó en las producciones “María Emilia”, “Pobre Diabla”, “Gente como uno”, “La Fuerza” y “Mi amor el wachiman 2”. En cine formó parte del elenco de la película “En Busca de Javier” próxima a estrenarse. Junto a Daría Moriano, conforma el colectivo “Umbral Azul”, poniendo en escena “Esquina Peligrosa” (2015) y “El Curioso caso del Cuerno de San Dios” (2016) en calidad de actor y productor.Belén Lengua “Sara”Formada en la facultad de artes escénicas de la PUCP en la especialidad de actuación. Ha realizado talleres complementarios de actuación con Alberto Isola, de improvisación con Carol Hernández y de clown con Andrea Pacheco. También ha recibido formación en ballet realizado en la Escuela de Ballet de San Marcos y Terpsicore; danza contemporánea con Marlon Cabellos, Acrobacia y Circo realizado en PowerFit . En teatro ha participado de las producciones “Spring Awakening”; “El Cementerio de Automóviles”; “Dios es un DJ”; “Tantas Cosas por Contar” (próxima a estrenarse); entre otras. Recientemente viene dedicándose a la docencia de teatro para niños en la PUCP y de manera independiente DIRECTORGabriel RosselA la fecha ha dirigido 20 montajes, entre puestas en escena de teatro, teatro musical y Teatro Para Niños; como “Rent: el Musical de Broadway”,“La Dieta Eterna”, “Alba y el Mounstruo”;  entre otras. Estudió dirección con Carlos Acosta, dramaturgia en la Asociación Cultural Aranwa y talleres de actuación con Enrique Victoria, Paco Varela y Rafael Sánchez Mena. story:
Old Rock is a strong supporter of Up Fest and Elgin Street Mission!

This summer, we want to inspire and brighten everyone’s day in Downtown Sudbury. We need your help to make these 2 initiatives a reality: 


+ New Mural for Downtown Sudbury
We’re "giving" our Minto location's south wall to Sudbury and Up Fest.

+ Coffee Fund for the Elgin Street Mission
We want to ensure patrons of this local shelter always have fresh coffee.

Our goal is $10,000 - that’s $5,000 for each cause. If we reach our goal, all additional funds will be applied towards the Elgin Street Mission Coffee Fund.



ART + MUSIC + COFFEE + YOU  

Urban Art for Downtown Sudbury

Up Fest is a public art festival that culminates in an emerging music festival and is topped off by an all-night art crawl.  From August 13 - 15, 2015, over 35 musicians in over 7 venues will transform the downtown core for 3 jam packed days featuring an all-night art crawl where the weird and wonderful collide under city lights.  

As an official Mural Sponsor, Old Rock is committed to help transform our city by “giving” our south wall to Up Fest (and Sudbury). We believe that public art has the power to transform the way we view and interact with our city by bringing people together and connecting us with our urban landscape.


An inspiring mural will be painted on the north wall located at Old Rock Roastery, 212 Minto Street in Greater Sudbury and revealed during Up Fest 2015.



Coffee Fund for the Elgin Street Mission

Your sommelier de café believes everyone in our community should have quality tasting,  fresh & delicious coffee - that’s just part of our mission.

Our neighbours at the Elgin Street Mission are often in dire need of coffee. We want to ensure the patrons and volunteers of the shelter always have great tasting coffee.



Help Us Make It Happen

We’re excited to completely transform the Old Rock Minto location with an inspirational mural along Elgin St. (corner of Minto). Its design will focus on Sudbury, not Old Rock and will surely leave a lasting impression for Sudburians. The cost for Old Rock to participate and support Up Fest is $5,000.

Old Rock has also started a coffee fund for our neighbours at the Elgin Street Mission.  In collaboration with Pastor Rene, we estimated that the Elgin St. Mission needs an average of 16 lbs of coffee per day!  With your generosity, we hope to raise $5,000 for the Elgin Street Mission.  Your donation will  brighten the days of the patrons at Elgin Street Mission with delicious, fresh & local coffee. If we reach our goal, we’ll be able to start manufacturing coffee at cost (no profit) for the Elgin Street Mission.


Your Donation is Shared Equally

Old Rock will ensure that both causes are equally shared 50/50.  If we raise funds beyond our total goal of $10,000 ($5,000 for Up Fest and $5,000 for Elgin Street Mission), any additional amount beyond that will be applied to the Elgin Street Mission Coffee Fund.  


The Perks: Old Rock Sommelier Card

Old Rock has some great rewards for you! For every contribution over $20, you’ll receive a unique Sommelier Card preloaded with 25% of your donation. The Old Rock Sommelier Card makes a great gift card and acts as a very convenient cash card. To thank you, a 10% bonus will be added each time you load your card, forever.

Make a $10 Donation

  • Pay It Forward - We’ll buy someone a coffee on your behalf (:

Make a $20 Donation

  • Receive a $5 Sommelier Card - Exclusive Up Fest Edition

Make a $40 Donation

  • Receive a $10 Sommelier Card - Splurge on yourself or that special someone!

Make a $80 Donation

  • Receive a $20 Sommelier Card - Makes a great gift for any coffee lover!

Make a $100 Donation

  • Receive a $25 Sommelier Card + 1 Old Rock Mug

Make a $200 Donation

  • Receive a $50 Sommelier Card + 2 Old Rock Mugs

Make a $500 Donation

  • $125 Sommelier Card + 2 Old Rock Mugs +  Coffee for 3 months (value $120)


This exclusive Old Rock Sommelier Card will be in circulation & available for pickup at the Old Rock location on Minto in early August, in limited quantities. 


Bonuses & Milestones

If we meet our goal of $10,000 ($5,000 for both causes), the Old Rock Sommelier Card will return 25% bonus anytime you add funds to your account in 2015.

As we reach key milestones towards the $10,000, Old Rock will increase the bonus on this exclusive Up Fest Sommelier Card for the remainder of 2015:

++ $5000 to $7499 = 15% total bonus,

+++ $7500 to $9999 = 20% total bonus,

++++ $10,000 or more =  25% total bonus.



Shopping with OldRock.ca

Can’t make it to one of our locations or prefer to shop online? Once you make a donation, we'll be in touch with you to ask your preference. If you prefer, we’ll email you a coupon instead of a sommelier card. Next time you place an order, enter your coupon code at checkout and a discount worth your perk's amount will be applied to your order! 

Old Rock offers free Northern Ontario shipping*, $10 flat rate shipping anywhere in Canada or $15 flat rate shipping to the USA. If you’re from Greater Sudbury, take advantage of our FREE delivery or FREE Shipping. 

* To qualify, ship to a postal code starting with P


I’m not from Sudbury. Why should I support this?

Because you’ll be supporting art, cultural growth, community living, small(ish) towns. When you take the TransCanada highway and stop in Sudbury (which is a stop you’d make), you can visit downtown, point at Durham St. Old Rock mural, and say “Hey, I made that happen!”

Your donation will have a direct and positive impact on the patrons of Elgin St. Mission. With your generosity, Old Rock Coffee will surely brighten someone’s day at the shelter.


What is a “Sudbury”?

A “Sudbury” is the happiest city in Canada, located 4 hours North of Toronto, Ontario.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that giving money is not an option for many of us. Up Fest & Old Rock Coffee is for everyone to share in its glory regardless of whether or not you can make a monetary contribution.

We kindly ask that you:

  • Share this page with your friends and family, tell them why you think it's a great project, and ask for their support.
  • Share your love for Sudbury and spread the word about Up Fest and our coffee fund for the Elgin St. Mission.
  • Come out to Old Rock if you’re in town, say hi and get involved with the project. 

You’re Awesome (:

The Old Rock family thanks you all so much for your support and generosity! If you know our story, you know that Sudbury has always been the place we call home.

Together, let’s transform the happiest place to live in Canada.

story:
STRETCH / HOOK, a live performance integrating sculptural installation, dance and live music will premiere on May 28, 2016 at Cotuit Center for the Arts! We need YOUR HELP to make this happen!!!

STRETCH / HOOK 

STRETCH / HOOK is a powerful and provocative live performance integrating sculptural installation by visual artist John Cira; dance and choreography by award-winning performance artist DeAnna Pellecchia; and original music performed by legendary jazz pianist Kenny Werner.  STRETCH / HOOK innovatively explores and pushes the boundaries between three distinct art forms, taking audience on a visceral journey. 

"...you want to touch it, to swing on it,  to see if it bends, you want to photograph it, to paint it, to make a play within its spaces..."
- The Barnstable Patriot review of John Cira's spandex installation

"...muscular, mesmerizing...unforgettable."
- BAY WINDOWS review of dancer / choreographer DeAnna Pellecchia

"...to say that this music is affecting and enthralling would be a gross understatement.”
– ALL ABOUT JAZZ review of pianist Kenny Werner

STRETCH /HOOK is a fully collaborative effort, layering the expertise, imagination and perspective of each artist, producing a compelling, multi-sensory performance. John Cira’s mammoth rays of illuminated spandex growing out of the floor, walls and windows slice across the space creating an immersive landscape for dancer DeAnna Pellecchia. On her journey she climbs, dives, swings, confronts and embraces, disappearing into and emerging from the towering walls of fabric. The kinetic facades alternate from blockade to cradle; obstacle to vehicle; friend to foe. Jazz pianist Kenny Werner, heralded as one of the greatest pianists of our time, plays a spontaneous composition, acting as a fluid partner for the athletic and daring choreography. The three elements intertwine and drive each other, culminating in a literal unraveling and exciting transformation of the installation itself. STRETCH / HOOK features original lighting design by Lynda Rieman and couture costuming by fashion designer Carlos Villamil.

 Why this work is important...

STRETCH / HOOK is a performance experience that engages and inspires. John Cira, DeAnna Pellecchia and Kenny Werner have each been making innovative art in their fields for decades. STRETCH / HOOK is a meeting of their three distinct art forms, their three unique voices, in real-time, improvisational conversation. Cira, Pellecchia and Werner connect with audience through an intimate evening of exploration and live performance that is moving, exhilarating and transcendent.  

Why we need your help...

KAIROS Dance Theater & John Cira Arts in collaboration with Kenny Werner and Cotuit Center for the Arts will premiere STRETCH / HOOK on Saturday, May 28th, 2016. We need to raise $8,000 to cover production costs which include materials for installation, set & costumes, lighting equipment, artists fees, sound and video recording, marketing & promotional costs, and other costs associated with the premiere of STRETCH / HOOK.

The May 28th premiere is the first step towards organizing a tour of STRETCH / HOOK to theaters, educational institutions and venues both nationally and internationally!!!

We would like to thank you in advance for your support on this exciting project. Please check out our perks!

What you get...

Your name in the social media news about the project?  An original John Cira print or sculpture? A signed frameable poster of the project? Tickets to the premiere or an invitation to a rehearsal? 

These perks are a just a small token of our eternal appreciation and a way that you can become an important part of this project.

Other ways you can help...

We know that it's not always possible to give a monetary donation, but there are other ways you can help us! 

  • Get the word out to your social media network on Facebook, Twitter, etc.. 
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools, and let us know what else you need to spread the word effectively.
  • Reach out to your friends who can afford to make a financial pledge.  We actually DO believe that people want to  be asked to help.

YOU are instrumental in helping us bring this project to life. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you at the premiere on May 28th!

story:
Nos proponemos influenciar a través del arte y la acción comunitaria medidas que busquen fomentar una ciudadanía genuina de las comunidades. 

Más info: http://bembaprints.wix.com/bemba#!blank/c10s7

story:
Pour les 30 ans de Regart, centre d’artistes en art actuel, nous lançons REGART VERS LE FUTUR, une campagne de financement pour assurer la pérennité de notre petit organisme. Notre campagne est divisée en deux projets mobilisateurs: la bonification des ressources humaines et la création d’un fonds de dotation.



Équipe Regart


À propos de Regart, centre d’artistes en art actuel  
 

Implanté à Lévis depuis 1986, le centre d’artistes Regart assure une présence dynamique des arts visuels actuels auprès des publics des territoires de Chaudière-Appalaches et de Québec. Notre mission est de favoriser l’hybridation des formes d’art, ainsi que la rencontre et le mélange des genres et des disciplines. Cette approche, tant dans les processus de création que dans la scénographie des expositions, nous permet d’ouvrir de nouvelles perspectives qui diffèrent des contextes habituels de diffusion. Regart présente des expositions dans sa galerie, dans sa Vitrine des membres et en espace public, en plus d’organiser une pluralité d'événements tels que des rencontres avec les artistes, des lancements de publications et des initiatives de nos membres.

Paul Brunet 
Olivier Roberge 
À quoi servira votre don? 

Votre don va permettre d’améliorer grandement les conditions de travail de nos employé/e/s. D’abord par l’embauche d’une troisième personne à la coordination des expositions entre 2017 et 2019, qui contribuera à l’énergie et à la folie de l’équipe en place. Puis par la bonification du salaire des deux employées actuelles. Ces bonifications permettront de poursuivre notre développement en se démarquant par des projets d’envergure, surprenants et réjouissants tout en respectant une éthique salariale professionnelle. Et enfin, si votre générosité est débordante, Regart pourra embaucher un intégrateur web pour opérer la refonte du site web, au grand plaisir de tout le monde qui vient nous visiter virtuellement.

Pour les centres d’artistes, et tout OBNL du milieu culturel, le financement le plus difficile à obtenir est celui des ressources humaines. Et pourtant une bonne équipe est sans doute la ressource la plus précieuse en culture puisqu’elle permet de mettre sur pied des projets créatifs, de chercher l’innovation et de développer des collaborations. Ce projet de financement offrira non seulement un environnement de travail sain à l’équipe, mais permettra aussi de bonifier nos services offerts aux artistes et à la population, d’augmenter notre rayonnement, d’assurer une pérennité de l’équipe, et ce, en participant au mouvement de revitalisation du secteur de la traverse à Lévis. 

Votre don pourra aussi être propulsé vers le futur grâce au programme Mécénat Placements Culture qui triple la mise au moment où les dons sont investis dans un fonds de dotation. Ce programme permettra à Regart de se faire un coussin alors que le climat est à l’austérité et que les sources publiques de revenu tendent à s’amenuiser. Bref, avec votre don nous préparons les 30 prochaines années.


Amélie Laurence Fortin
Marie-Andrée Godin
30 ans d’histoire en bref
 

C’est suite à une exposition collective - ayant pour titre REGART - présentée dans un local vacant de Lévis, que le Collectif Regart voit le jour en 1986. Jusqu’en 1991, le Collectif Regart se consacre à rendre accessible un espace de création pour ses artistes membres. C'est aussi en 1991 que Regart devient un centre de diffusion avec des locaux permanents sur la côte du passage dans le Vieux-Lévis en poursuivant son mandat initial de faire se rejoindre l’art et l’écriture. En 2009, le centre élargit son champ d’action avec un nouveau mandat multidisciplinaire et devient Regart, centre d’artistes en art actuel. Puis le centre déménage en 2011 dans le secteur du traversier Lévis-Québec. En plus de diffuser des expositions en galerie et en vitrine, Regart offre également des ateliers en location pour les artistes-membres.


Contreparties liées aux dons


Pour un don de 10$

Reconnaissance

Un gros merci pour un petit coup de pouce grandement apprécié!


Pour un don de 20$

Jamais sans mon macaron

Regart vous fera parvenir un macaron orné du logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR ou de dessins réalisés par Amélie Laurence Fortin, Paul Brunet, Marie-André Godin ou  Olivier Roberge. 


Pour un don de 50$

Joindre l’utile à l’artistique

Vous pourrez choisir entre un t-shirt orné d'un dessin original de Paul Brunet ou du logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR, un sac réutilisable mis en valeur par une oeuvre de Marie-Andrée Godin ou d'Amélie Laurence Fortin, ou bien des bobettes illustrées par une oeuvre d'Olivier Roberge ou par le logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR. 


Pour un don de 100$

Occuper l'espace

Regart met à votre disposition l'espace d'atelier commun pour une durée de trois jours. Que ce soit pour une fête de famille, une exposition de courte durée, une mini-résidence ou une soirée de performance, l'espace est à vous!


Pour un don de 500$

On vous reçoit en grand

Invité/é d'honneur à une soirée VIP qui sera l'occasion d'un contact privilégié avec la commissaire et avec les artistes qui prennent part à l'exposition du 30e anniversaire de Regart. Vous pourrez en outre choisir entre un t-shirt orné d'un dessin original de Paul Brunet ou du logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR, un sac réutilisable mis en valeur par une oeuvre de Marie-Andrée Godin ou d'Amélie Laurence Fortin, ou bien des bobettes illustrées par une oeuvre d'Olivier Roberge ou par le logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR. 


Pour un don de 1000$

D'une exposition à l'autre

Vous serez gâté/e, à l’année! Regart vous fera parvenir, à quatre reprises au cours de l’année 2016-2017, un panier garni avec des œuvres originales, des invitations spéciales et autres gâteries en lien avec notre programmation! Vous compterez parmi celles-ci une invitation à la soirée VIP organisée à l’occasion de notre exposition célébrant le 30e anniversaire du centre. Vous pourrez en aussi choisir entre un t-shirt orné d'un dessin original de Paul Brunet ou du logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR, un sac réutilisable mis en valeur par une oeuvre de Marie-Andrée Godin ou d'Amélie Laurence Fortin, ou bien des bobettes illustrées par une oeuvre d'Olivier Roberge ou par le logo de la campagne REGART VERS LE FUTUR.
story_txt:
Pour les 30 ans de Regart, centre d’artistes en art actuel, nous lançons REGART VERS LE FUTUR, une campagne de financement pour assurer la pérennité de notre petit organisme. Notre campagne est divisée en deux projets mobilisateurs: la bonification des ressources humaines et la création d’un fonds de dotation.


Équipe RegartÀ propos de Regart, centre d’artistes en art actuel   


Implanté à Lévis depuis 1986, le centre d’artistes Regart assure une présence dynamique des arts visuels actuels auprès des publics des territoires de Chaudière-Appalaches et de Québec. Notre mission est de favoriser l’hybridation des formes d’art, ainsi que la rencontre et le mélange des genres et des disciplines. Cette approche, tant dans les processus de création que dans la scénographie des expositions, nous permet d’ouvrir de nouvelles perspectives qui diffèrent des contextes habituels de diffusion. Regart présente des expositions dans sa galerie, dans sa Vitrine des membres et en espace public, en plus d’organiser une pluralité d'événements tels que des rencontres avec les artistes, des lancements de publications et des initiatives de nos membres.

story:
Hello,

I am Jessica Karuhanga. Earlier this year I was invited to perform at, Encuentro, a bi-annual performance festival hosted by The Hemispheric Institute of Performance and Politics.  This year's theme is eX-céntrico: dissidence, sovereignties, performance and will run July 17 - 23 2016 in Santiago, Chile. 

In Encuentro's words the eX-centric is "that which stands apart, on the peripheries of power—as a site of identity, struggle, creativity, and political power. We understand the eX-centric as the dissident, that which stands apart, creating a space outside that makes possible other futures, subjectivities, and ways of doing and knowing." 

I will performing at the inauguration in Casa Central at Universidad de Chile.

You can learn more about Encuentro here: 

http://hemisphericinstitute.org/hemi/en/encuentro

You may experience most of my work here:  http://jessicakaruhanga.com/home.html

What I Need & What You Get

I am requesting $3, 500 CAD to mitigate the expenses of my endeavor. Your supporting my campaign will contribute to professional development, a round-trip flight from Toronto, Canada to Santiago, Chile, accommodations + food during my stay, campaign hosting fees as well as labor and production costs of the gifts you will receive as incentive. 

Gifts will range from artist multiples such as mixtapes, zines of poetry and drawings, video performances and artist-hosted dinners.

Why You Should Support

I vacillated back and forth as to whether or not to invest my energies in a fundraiser. To let this go. This has everything to do with the kind of vulnerability required to ask for help and reiterating the validity of one's work within a cultural framework of paternalistic generosity. Last year I launched my first fundraiser so I could participate in NYU's Black Portraitures Conference in Florence, Italy. That campaign was remarkably successful and affirmed that my practice matters to multiple communities beyond my scope. I still struggle processing holding this power, this weight, this worth. 

I support myself solely  from a full-time  minimum-wage job. This is barely a living wage when one considers the cost of living in a dynamic space such as Toronto. Balancing and coordinating a job with an art practice can be exhausting. So many of us over-extend in the name of productivity. In Canada we are benefited with several granting systems however we aren't always assured financial support for our visions. My application for a travel grant was rejected. I do not have the energies or time to refute/appeal this rejection and I am simply not in a position to sponsor myself during the interim. I am resourceful, resilient, and stubborn so I am going to try to get to Santiago using a different pathway. This is why I am asking you friends, colleagues and the public to support my campaign and ensure my presence at this festival.

Hype + Supportive Gestures

I recognize some of you  cannot financially contribute. Know that your nourishment, engagement and thoughtful criticism  have been and still remain significant gifts to me. I see all of you holding me up. Also, there are many ways, beyond the monetary, that you can help make campaign #hype  - Share my campaign within your social spheres + social media.

Special thanks to my fam for helping me put this campaign together:

Basil Alzeri, Golboo Amani, Francisco-Fernando Granados, Manolo Lugo, and Lido Pimienta

Credits:

Video shot by Manolo Lugo with excerpts from video by Jessica Karuhanga
