story:
Posters are available now from eBay!

Head here to get your set of three posters for $80 + shipping, this is still the best deal on the internet for full size prints of these posters, and these are super high quality!

NASA Exoplanet Travel Bureau Posters on now available on Ebay!

Relax on Kepler-16b 

I'm a space nerd who really likes the posters that NASA produced as part of their PlanetQuest program called the Exoplanet Travel Series. These posters are beautiful 1930's style travel posters highlighting Exoplanets that have been found in near space. 

I am going to print these posters at full resolution on 27"x39"  high quality uncoated cover stock. The source images are from the JPL website and are 300 dpi tiff files.

Here are the details for each poster:

  • HD 40307g
  • Kepler-186f
  • Kepler-16b

What We Need & What You Get

I need: enough capital (and expressed interest to do a run of at least 100 of each poster to make it economical.

The Perks:

  • For $60 you get one of each 27" x 39" poster printed on high quality, uncoated cover stock, and shipped in a 3x30" kraft mailing tube to anywhere in the USA. Poster does not include frame.All gone! Only offered to pre-funding backers.
  • For $25 you can any poster of your choosing. Pre-orders are over, I'll post an update when the posters are available through a retail channel.

Actual Posters

Risks & Challenges

This is super low risk. I am only doing a print run if I meet the funding goal. If I don't, this is an all or nothing campaign so you never get charged!

I have experience doing mail fulfillment for fundraising campaigns, involving ordering and shipping a large number of pre-ordered t-shirts. A professional print designer is helping me work with the printer to ensure our proofs and paper are of the highest quality.

We are also operating within the JPL Image Use Policy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.

story:
A little bit about me


Hey there, I'm Dani Diez.

 If I had to describe myself, I'd say I'm a professional illustrator, a painter, a concept artist or maybe a draftsman too... so just mix them up and there you go! :)

I've been working as an art director in video games for a few years and I'm currently creating concept art for the animation film industry. 

This is my first attempt for what I really want to end up doing; I'd like to share my personal ideas with you.

 This is why I'm collecting daily drawings from my sketchbooks and projects into a beautifully printed book I've called "The Draftsman's Close".



I've been asked sometimes if I have any books of my artwork. Well, I've never done one before so I've decided to put together my sketches, drawings, and doodles from over the years, and show you an idea of their creative processes.

I need your help getting funded so that I can cover my costs of printing a first run of these sketchbooks. 




The Sketchbook


- Size: 148x210mm (5.8x8.3 inches)

- Perfect Bound Paperback

- 100 pages aprox, full of sketches and drawings including many never ever published works.

- Includes an in-depth showcase exploring my creative process, including sketches and preliminaries. 

- You will also find notes and little explanations.

- High quality printing. ( I want the drawings to look as close to the hand-made ones as possible, so I'm putting a lot of effort in the printing.)



What I need, what you get

I would like to make an initial printing run of 200 books, which will cost approximately $900 to get printed. 

The book will be sent to you for free, regardless of the country. Shippings will cost about $300. 

Indiegogo's and Paypal's fees will be around $200.

I'm also making postals, posters and bookmarks too; in order for you to have very special rewards. I've been preparing a few funding tiers with perks, so each person can choose the one they like the most.


The Shaman Series

During September '14 I did a self challenge: To draw a character per day, under the topic "Shamans". A lot of artists joined me using the tag #Septemberofshamans.

All the shamans are included in Draftsman's Close!


The Rewards


-Digital Edition-

A digital copy of Draftsman's Close sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

-The Draftman's Close-

 A physical edition shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

-The Print Set-

A physical edition + a print shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

-The Poster Set-

A physical edition + poster + a print shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

-Collector's Edition-

A physical edition + poster + three prints shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

-The Golden Bundle-

A physical edition + a poster + three prints + original sketch shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

-The Ultimate Bundle-

A physical edition + poster + three prints + an original colored sketch shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.

___________________________________________________________________

NEW REWARD LEVEL!: -The Ultimate Ink Bundle-

A physical edition + poster + three prints + an original INKED sketch shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in "The Draftsman's Close"!

Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!


If you'd like to see more of my art and stay connected here's where I hang:

Instagram

Facebook

Website

Behance


Thanks a million for your time and support! 
~Dani Diez

-The Ultimate Bundle-






A physical edition + poster + three prints + an original colored sketch shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.



___________________________________________________________________
NEW REWARD LEVEL!: -The Ultimate Ink Bundle-

A physical edition + poster + three prints + an original INKED sketch shipped to you + digital edition sent via wetransfer.



Other Ways You Can Help
I know that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in "The Draftsman's Close"!
Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!

If you'd like to see more of my art and stay connected here's where I hang:
Instagram
FacebookWebsiteBehance
Thanks a million for your time and support! 
~Dani Diez

story:
Short Summary

Pivot Arts is producing our third annual festival of innovative performance throughout Uptown, Edgewater and Rogers Park.

By giving to Pivot Arts, you gain the opportunity to contribute to innovation in the arts AND make neighborhoods on the far north side thrive. Because of our diverse programming, your donation supports music, dance, theater, puppetry, performances for children and exciting events like this year's PARADE!

This year's festival theme is CELEBRATE COMMUNITY! From May 28 to June 7, the Pivot Arts Festival features performances from dance innovators Lucky Plush Productions, improv masters Storytown, electric house band BAATHHAUS, Clown artists Dean Evans and Vanessa Valliere, Grammy-nominated singer Justin Roberts, and many many more.

What We Need & What You Get

We can't do it without you! Festival expenses are at $50,000. We need to raise an additional $2,500 from individual donors for this summer's festival. Your money will go to:

- Creating large-scale puppets with Swift School Students for the Celebrate Community Parade

- Compensating professional artists & organizations, including Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter Justin Roberts!

We'll respond with public acknowledgement of your donation, free tickets, and even chances to meet and connect with our amazing artists! Pivot Arts is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit charitable organization and your donation is tax deductible to the extent of the law.

Join us for any of our events this summer! For more information and tickets go to: www.pivotarts.org/festival


Other Ways You Can Help

- Share our campaign with your friends. Like us on Facebook, Follow us on Twitter and stay updated about our events by signing our mailing list at pivotarts.org/updates.

- Come to a Pivot Arts event! We have performances for all ages that range from free to just a small ticket fee.

- Volunteer, email us at info@pivotarts.org if you would like to help with the festival.

Pivot Arts is...

Board Members Alyssa Berman-Cutler, April Browning,  Julieanne Ehre, Gretchen Halpin, Mark E. Lococo, Summur Roberts, Kathy Van Zwoll.

Associates Katy Collins, Dan Cox, Joanne Dill, Eric Reda, Tanya Palmer, Temple Schultz, Meg Sutter.

story:
What The Initiative Is:


The ï¿½Weï¿½re All Human Beingsï¿½ Initiative is a humanitarian art initiative aimed to unite different cultures of people by exposing the similarities in our desires as humans. My attempt is to bring about an awareness that, simply put, we are all human beings.

I want to create artwork with a purpose and I want people from different parts of the world to know just how similar they really are. That is the basis on which I have built the ï¿½Weï¿½re All Human Beingsï¿½ Initiative.

I moved to Rwanda and had the opportunity to meet a wide variety of people. People that I can relate to and people that I know friends of mine could easily relate to. I thought, ï¿½I wish my friends could meet these peopleï¿½, and the best way that I thought to introduce the two, who are continents apart, is through artwork.

My plan is to create artwork based on the individuals that I have come across in my time here and to learn and reveal one desire in their life. I will then create an abstract representation of their personal desire and screen print it onto canvas for shows and onto paper to sell (if there is enough demand).


I want to display one simple fact: the desires of humans all across the globe are not that different from one to another.

(Video Coming Soon)


How The Initiative Started:


In May of 2011 I developed a series of Mixed-Media Screen Prints titled the ï¿½Weï¿½re All Human Beingsï¿½ Series (they can be seen online at www.davisionary.supermarketHQ.com. I had just finished reading a book called Mountains Beyond Mountains by Tracy Kidder which follows the co-founder, Dr. Paul Farmer, of a non-profit organization, Partners In Health, back and forth between Boston and rural Haiti. At one point in the book Dr. Farmer takes a woman and her child to a hospital to get a blood transfusion and when they arrived they were told there was no more blood to give. Hopeless, the woman cried, ï¿½tout moun se mounï¿½, ï¿½weï¿½re all human beingsï¿½. Why is there no blood, weï¿½re all human beings? This phrase has come to be the mission of who I am as an artist. I have become hopelessly devoted to creating art with a purpose. Whether a portion of the sale goes to a good cause or the subject of my work raises awareness.

In September of 2011 my wife got a job offer from Partners In Health, which would soon send us to Rwanda. As we were both big fans of the organization I encouraged her to accept the job and told her I would come along with her despite the fact that I had no idea how I would continue to create art and even what my artwork would become. I figured that I would find a way to continue screen-printing or else I would revert back to good ole pen and pencil. When I arrived I found out that it was very possible to screen print, all I needed to do was find the materials, equipment and studio space to do it. I have struck a deal with Adam Amoroso, an Initiative partner of mine, that he will allow me to use a bit of studio space in his workshop for one year and for a small fee.

 

Why I need the $:


            I recently got a part-time job as a Designer/Art Director or a design firm in the capitol of Rwanda. Between my wife and I, we make enough money to eat and travel back and forth to visit each other on weekends. That is why I need your help!

            I love the idea of using a grassroots funding campaign to raise money for an initiative called, ï¿½Weï¿½re All Human Beingsï¿½. Itï¿½s only appropriate. Below is a very specific outline of what it is I need and what it would cost. We need the initial funding to pay for the materials to begin the Initiative. At this point, I have absolutely nothing I need to create artwork. This $5,000 is for the basicï¿½s.

            After I get the project going I plan to apply for various grants to continue the project and even to expand it to different countries around the world.

 

Where the $ is going:


The money is staying local. I want to keep all of the materials from the region or from regions nearby. On the Gallery page is a budget for everything I need and what it costs and where I will get it from.

story:
Short Summary

In 1971, Lewis VanDercar was hired to build a dragon on the incredibly unique property at the very southern most tip of Merritt Island, Florida.

"Annie" which was the dragons nickname, graced the point of the property for over 31 years as a Brevard County landmark and all around Icon. Because the dragon has always been in someones backyard, the dragon fell into the same disrepair as the home and the entire property, as homeowners struggled with markets and various lawsuits that came into the picture over the years.

As a florida native and resident of Brevard for the last 30 years, I've seen the condition of the dragon slowly just collapse on to the island, to what is now just a heap. It was my opinion that the main problem was that the super awesome landmark needed to be removed from the realestate world and cared for by the locals that love her.

We have come along way from the idea to the day we buy the land!

So now we are in negotiations with the bank and do now plan to buy the entire historic property as a community. Remove the home and rebuild the dragon.

The property will be private accept for times that the property can be rented for special occassions, such as weddings.

So please help us as a community of universal dragon lovers, to help restore the local landmark and help maintain the condition of the dragon for years to come! Thank You!

What We Need & What You Get

Our entire project, to obtain the property, restore the land and rebuild the dragon is just under a million dollar project. Of course thats what we would love to accomplish, but in the chance that we don't raise every penny by our end of this year deadline, we will seek a banks assistance to cover the rest, and then pay them back.

We would like to share the experience with you, so we have a couple of ways to reward donations. First is an "Adopt-A-Scale" program, which will come with a certificate of adoption and either your name on the supporters wall or a limited amount of people can get their name actually on the dragon.

Also the rare remains of the dragon can be shared amongst the donors. Alone or in a beautiful shadow box along with a dragon scale.

The Impact

There are now dragon lovers all over the world! Its amazing to me how many people have been affected so positively by Annie and her quirky look! So many had the chance to visit her on the weekends and create these magical memories of a special time with special people.

This campaign has the opportunity to ensure a new generation of dragon lovers and the memories that they will create!

You can sense the excitement when people find out that we are trying to bring Annie back home to her historic perch!

Theres a sense of the community coming together for a good cause that the entire world could share in. Long live Annie!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can visit savedragonpoint.org to see other ways to volunteer or buy a t-shirt.

Also please take advantage of Indiegogo's share tools to help spread the word!

 

A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL-FREE (800-435-7352) WITHIN THE STATE. REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY ENDORSEMENT, APPVAL, OR RECOMMENDATION BY THE STATE. Registration Number CH38042

story:
Short Summary

My name is Madeleine Marine.  I am a commercial and fine art photography student working on my final portrait portfolio.  I have been a photographer for six years doing paid commercial work and conceptual artistic work for myself.  My specialty is abstract people portraits.  My personal artistic projects are always emotionally driven, honest, and vulnerable.

There will be 6 final images, and a short film of each of the six scenes.

This project is my most gorgeous, highest production value, and most heartfelt series of images I will have done so far.  It is my labor of love and something that I hope to publish and print and cherish for the rest of my career. 

If you contribute to funding my project, you will be helping me begin my foreseeable successful professional career with an amazing portfolio.

I am so lucky to have a hard-working, and committed pre-production and production crew working with me to help make this dream come true.  All of the shots are storyboarded, shot lists are made, locations are scouted, and we are casting professional actors to be a part of the project.

What We Need & What You Get

I will be funding a good part of the production but I would like $750 to help pay for location, props, actors, equipment, printing and supplies, food for the crew, and transportation.  We are shooting on location and designing each scene to recreate the past, revive past emotions, and make each image look like a gorgeous, emotionally driven cinematic still.

A fraction of funds will go towards rewards. I am offering large, signed prints-- individually and full series-- and books with the full series and their corresponding story and concept behind each image.

The more contributions I get, the better the quality I can my my production and presentation.

    The Impact

    If you help fund my project, you will help me share my stories.  You will help me inspire and evoke warm feelings of love and passion.  You will help me kick off my professional career with an other-worldly, gorgeous series of fine art portraits.

      Risks & Challenges

      If we do not reach our goal, the production value of my labor of love may be compromised. My crew and I will work as hard as we can with whatever funds we have to continue to try as hard as possible to create the beautiful photography series we envision. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Ever contribution-- no matter how small-- helps enormously. If you cannot afford to help fun my project, please inform other and share my proposal with your friends, acquaintances and family.

story:
In BIOARTNERGY we combine biosciences with art in the form of installations, hands on workshops and various media work. We collaborate with many artists around Yogyakarta and once per year we try to show the bio-art produced by citizen science communities in our festival on Open Science and Art.   By this campaign we want to share and publish our movement as students to give more education for public about the importance of bioscience in unique and creative way! 
If you are passionate about science and you are interested to see our documentation from the festival, send us a small contribution and become a supporter of open science efforts in the Global South.

BIOARTNERGY #3:

After the success of BIOARTNERGY #1 and BIOARTNERGY #2,  BIOARTNERGY #3 will have a theme - “A journey to the unseen world”.  We will reveal the secrets of the minuscule world ignored by the society. The exhibited projects will show the wonder and importance of those microorganisms in many aspects of life. With this theme we also try to challenge the creativity of students and our partners on how they’d see the facts of life in their own perspective and present them in an interesting way. We hope that this would fulfill our main goal, that is to enlighten the general public just how fascinating and significant is the presence of the little giants in the everyday life, and to kindle the potential of citizen science and DIY Bio in the society within the city of Yogyakarta, and possibly Indonesia.

BIOARTNERGY #3 will take place in Yogyakarta, the city of art and culture, where art exhibition can be seen just about every day, but we can tell you for sure that BIOARTNERGY is one of the pioneer of science-art exhibition in Indonesia, especially Yogyakarta. This event is also the first established science-art exhibition organized by students of UNIVERSITAS GADJAH MADA. The detail is as follows:

  • Time  : Saturday to Sunday, November 22nd-23rd 2014
  • Venue  : Jogjakarta National Museum, Jl. Prof Ki Amri Yahya no.1, Gampingan, Wirobrajan, Yogyakarta, Special District of Yogyakarta, Indonesia

Here's the documentation of BIOARTNERGY #1 (2012) and BIOARTNERGY #2 (2013) to give you an impression about what BIOARTNERGY is:

Bioethanol Symphony : Using Bioethanol as Fuel for Mini Gamelan Installation


MI : SC "Microbial Orchestra"

Ritus Air (When God Gives The World Microalgae)

Algae Paper Cutout & Silhouette


DIY Microscope, DIY Laser Microscopy and Moist Sense Installation

Workshop about simple biotechnology around us

The Visitors Will Be Guided By Students To Get Explanation


The Projects:

1. Micro-Pix
Micro-Pix is an artwork which used pigmented microbes to make mozaic formation, This project needs a lot of petridishes and media for microbial growth. 
 

2. Mini Microbe Plush
The students make this handmade plush and dedicated to the kids as our effort to introduce microbiology for them.  The picture above is just one of the many designs available. You can get these cute plushies as a merchandise for the Bagong Pack or higher.

And many other projects.. (Will be updated soon)

Reward :

By choosing the Gareng Pack or any perk higher ($50 or more) you will get this T-Shirt as one of your rewards. 

---------------------
Your contribution will help us pay the production costs related to the exhibition, document the artworks, and organize workshop in local schools introducing Microbiology and DIYbio as social movement for open science. We also make this campaign as a mean of publication so that our project may be more well known in the public.

Updates about the project will be posted in our site at http://www.bioartnergy.com/

story:
Short summary

RECENS paper is an avant-garde magazine and platform, founded and based in Scandinavia. We want to build an international audience, gather young talent, and focus on what is contemporary in regards to aesthetic appreciation, past and present. Bored with saturated, commercial industry, Recens Paper commands a new, raw archetype of culture and fashion. RECENS paper is run by an international network of a wide range of young people with different talents and backgrounds.

In February of 2014, RECENS paper hosted a large, successful launch party during Oslo Fashion Week. There were 1,000 printed copies of Recens paper’s first issue, sold through our web shop and the F5 Concept Store, which is one of Norway’s most innovative store and platform.

What We Need & What You Get

In preparation for our SECOND ISSUE, we are expanding our team in order to expand our content and distribution. We are focusing on an international audience, and are currently pursuing marketing managers in over 15 countries, including Germany, France, the United Kingdom, the United States, Australia, Canada, and of course Scandinavia. We are a small, intimate and independent magazine, with a mission to print and distribute ourselves, with the help of potential global partners.

Our upcoming issue, “EXPLORARE”, is like a second chapter of our project. We filled our first issue, “Identify” with pertinent, youthful content — it explored the process of realization of identity: how we build off of our personal foundations. This second issue is about exploring, challenging and experimenting – exploring yourself and your life, the world, your hometown, your interests, your sexual orientation, fashion, music, art. Cultural and aesthetic creations often reflect life’s cyclical nature, and we wish to explore these reflections and patterns.

We have collaborated with a wide range of photographers, illustrators, poets and journalists, models, designers, stylists, and hair and makeup artists, in this issue. We aim to make “Explorare” an issue that culminates varied, global talent, while presenting the aforementioned in our signature Scandinavian minimalism. Our editorials are the Brainchildren of many creative youth at work; they are documentation of their explorations with light, texture, materials, finishes, and other nuanced mediums. Our written content is published by talented writers and journalists, who convey interesting, conceptual points of view in the way of interviews, personal essays, text collections, and beyond.

Please donate money to help us covering the printing costs of our non-commercial magazine, RECENS paper- in exchange for a personal feature in the printed fund-raiser shout out-site of our upcoming issue, EXPLORARE, as well as receiving a free copy of the magazine.

The Impact

At its core, RECENS PAPER explores the ideas brought forth by the very global and current generation. With rampant commercialism glazing and homogenizing the once-creative ideals of fashion and culture publications, we aim to recapture to honest and original attitudes to today’s young people.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate financial support – as well as support in regards to sharing our project and campaign. Please spread the word; let us make some noise about our campaign!

story:
Open your eyes to the world of colourful imagery and intricate design with our 3D display pieces. An essential piece for any surrounding: Classroom, office or even in your own home. 

Let us take you on a journey of some of the world’s most acclaimed headline viruses and bacterium. Presenting to you – The Contagion Cubes

 

 

From Smallpox to Ebola, we have created six 3D designs of some of the world’s most destructive viruses and bacterium. Crafted into 3D cubes, these scientific visuals are infused with colour to achieve huge impact.

The Contagion Cubes are brought to you by a team of young innovative designers who have worked tirelessly to deliver smart and conceptual design as demonstrated throughout our project.

 

 The Contagion Cubes are more than just an accessory, they are truly a work of art. This tangible design has been carefully crafted to depict the designer’s replication of each product.

Not only does this accredit its use as an educational aid but also creates a huge sense of admiration towards the sheer detail and craftmanship put into each cube. A true head turner and conversation piece.

Each cube is polished to ensure a smooth surface but don't worry, we've made sure each individual virus and bacterium is sealed inside each cube so there's no fears of catching it!

We are using the very latest high quality technology to ensure each individual design achieves supreme colour and highlight small intricate details that really make them stand out from the crowd.

Let us take you on a Contagion Cube journey:

 The Black Death is one of our earliest Contagions on our collection’s timeline hitting its peak from 1347 to 1351, effecting areas throughout Eurasia, North Africa and Europe. The Black Death, also known as the Bubonic Plague, was a hugely disastrous global epidemic that resulted in the deaths of up to 75-200 million people.

 

 

Yersinia Pestis is a gram-negative, non-motile, rod-shaped, Coccobacillus Bacterium, without spores. This bacterium is the sole cause of the plague and is usually found in small mammals and their fleas.

 

Every Yersinia Pestis model is available in your choice of the following sizes:

2 cm Cube
3 cm Cube
4 cm Cube

 A virus that we are all too familiar with in everyday life. Coronaviruses are a type of virus. COVID-19 is a newly identified Coronavirus, otherwise known as SARS-CoV-2 that has caused a worldwide pandemic of respiratory illness.

The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 is one of the three biggest respiratory disease outbreaks across the human population and there is still currently no cure.

In our spectacular 3D depiction of COVID-19 you can clearly identify the structure of the molecule with clear indication of spike protein and lipid membranes.

Every COVID-19 model is available in your choice of the following sizes:

2 cm Cube
3 cm Cube
4 cm Cube

Ebola was first identified in the year 1976 in the Democratic Republic of Congo. This rare, severe illness attacks the immune system, causing extreme fluid loss and often death. Once infected victims can experience symptoms varying from fever, muscle pain, headache, and sore throat, followed by vomiting, diarrhoea, rash, and bleeding.

 

Ebola Virus is a cylindrical/tubular molecule and appears in a long, filamentous form. From our detailed model you will be able to see structurally that it resembles a length of thread.

 

Every Ebola Virus model is available in your choice of the following sizes:

2 cm Cube
3 cm Cube
4 cm Cube

The origin of Smallpox remains a mystery but is thought to date back to the Egyptian Empire around the 3rd century BCE (Before Common Era), based on a smallpox-like rash found on three mummies.

Smallpox was a highly contagious disease caused by Variola Virus. The disease was eradicated in 1980 after the success of a vaccination and is still considered to be one of the biggest achievements in international public health.

Every Smallpox model is available in your choice of the following sizes:

2 cm Cube
3 cm Cube
4 cm Cube

The Spanish Flu, commonly known as the 1918 flu pandemic, was one of the deadliest pandemics in history. This fatal flu is caused by an Influenza A virus Subtype H1N1.

 

In our precisely constructed 3D display of Influenza H1N1 you will be able to clearly identify:

 Neuraminidase – A type of Glycoside Hydrolase enzyme which help to move the virus particles through the infected cell and assist in budding from the host cells. Haemagglutinin – Causes red blood cells to clump together and binds the virus to the infected cell.

Every Influenza H1N1 model is available in your choice of the following sizes:

2 cm Cube
3 cm Cube
4 cm Cube

Zika Virus, first identified in the year 1947, is a virus transmitted primarily by Aedes mosquitoes. The virus was first discovered in monkeys in Uganda and was later identified in humans in 1952 in Uganda and the United Republic of Tanzania.

Zika viruses (ZIKVs) are members of the Flavivirus genus of the Flaviviridae family. Zika virions are comprised of an envelope and a nucleocapsid. The virus particles are spherical and small (approximately 50 nm in diameter) with an electron-dense core approximately 30 nm in diameter. The virion surface contains envelope protein (E) dimers and membrane (M) proteins in icosahedral-like symmetry all of which can be seen clearly in our Zika Virus 3D cube.

 

Every Zika Virus model is available in your choice of the following sizes:

2 cm Cube
3 cm Cube
4 cm Cube

Pandemic Pack:

 

Cube 1: Yersinia Pestis (The Black Death)

Cube 2: Influenza H1N1 (The Spanish Flu)

Cube 3: Smallpox

Cube 4: Coronavirus (COVID-19)

Cube 5: Zika Virus

Cube 6: Ebola Virus 

Our designers work hard to produce clean and innovative designs. Here’s how our designers take their ideas from initial thought to reality.

 

 

Whether you plan to buy a Contagion Cube for yourself or gift your loved one this year with a global pandemic of your choice, our unique and colourful designs are perfect for: 

 

 

 To put it simply – No one can compare! We are proud to say we are the first inventors on the market to create stunning 3D colourful imagery of our chosen contagions. The Contagion Cubes really are a unique addition to any collector. Our designers work tirelessly to ensure each image is crafted to the utmost quality for the enjoyment of our ever-growing consumer base.

 

 

 

We here at ProtoHype pride ourselves on being the hub of unique innovations. Adding the personality back into our products is what we do best. We are a team of creative artists, inventors and writers who aim to deliver products that put a smile on our client's faces.

We are an enthusiastic team with an abundance of exciting ideas and projects under our sleeves. We are bursting to show everyone our full potential. We truly believe in our team of young professionals and are excited to show the world what we are about and continue to create successful campaigns.

We are confident that our newest campaign, The Contagion Cubes, will be a unique addition to anyone’s 3D image collection and will successfully work as a visual aid for our consumers, whilst also delivering the high quality that we here at ProtoHype pride ourselves on.

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

We take pride in our strong manufacturing plan and supply chain in place, and we will work quickly and concisely to meet our delivery goals. Unforeseen production delays are always a real possibility specifically during recent times with COVID-19.

We take great care over our team here and will take all necessary steps to ensure they are always working in a safe environment. However, we promise that you will always have our full disclosure should any delays occur. Communicating with you in a timely manner and ensuring the earliest possible delivery of a high-quality product will always be one of our top priorities.

 

Environmental Commitments:

Long-lasting design

We have designed our products to be durable and long lasting.

Reusability and recyclability

We use eco-friendly and recyclable packaging.

Sustainable materials

Our packaging is made from recyclable materials.

story:
©Stuart Shils

 

Stuart Shils: Reaching for a Flock of Canaries will be the seventh lecture in the Norma Shatan  Memorial Lecture Series. The lecture by Shils the juror for Prince Street Gallery's 9th Annual National Juried Show, is scheduled for Friday, July 14 at 6 PM, in conjunction with the exhibit. Stuart Shils will discuss his paintings followed by a short Q&A.  The evening event will conclude with a reception for the artist and guests.

STUART SHILS has been the recipient of numerous awards, including an Academy Award in Art from the Academy of Arts and Letters in New York.   He  studied at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, Philadelphia College of Art, Temple and Drew Universities.  Shils has had  solo shows in New York, Philadelphia, Tel Aviv, Boston, Scottsdale, Stuttgart, Los Angeles, Richmond, San Francisco and Cork (Ireland). Critical reviews have appeared in numerous newspapers, journals and magazines including The Brooklyn Rail, The New York Times, The New Yorker, The New York Sun, Ha'aretz, The Jerusalem Post, artcritical.com, The Wall Street Journal, The Boston Globe, The Boston Phoenix, The Philadelphia Inquirer, The Irish Times, Art in America, The New Republic, The New Criterion, Art New England, American Artist and The Hudson Review. A recent interview about his current work: http://paintingperceptions.com/stuart-shils-par...

Shils painted outside or looking through windows for 30 years, but more recently works in the studio, with cut and torn papers and often pieces of tape. Years ago, his paintings exploring the atmospheric engine of the northwest coast of Ireland, a 13 year painting campaign, were featured in the PBS film documentary, “Ballycastle”. 

Typically now, his thoughts turn more to the distinctive acoustical space of birds drawing with their voices in the morning forest. 

The Norma Shatan Memorial Lecture Series was named for Norma Shatan, one of the founders of Prince Street Gallery.  She was an influential artist whose vision helped shape the gallery at its inception in 1970.  She exhibited  regularly at the gallery until her death in 2005. Each talk in the lecture series is given by an artist or writer who serves as juror for our annual national juried show.  Previous lecturers include:

  • Philip Pearlstein
  • Robert Berlind (for Irving Sandler)
  • Susanna Coffey
  • Yvonne Jacquette
  • Lois Dodd
  • Robert Berlind

The lecture is free;  however, your donation in any amount will help our lecture series succeed:  The donated funds will support speaker fees and related expenses of this and forthcoming talks.

We offer several benefits for generous donations for reserved seating!            

  •  Reserved seating for 1 guest = $15 
  •  Reserved seating for 2 guests = $25 ( a $5 savings  on the second seat)
  •  Reserved seating for 3 or more = $10 ( a $5 savings per seat)
  •  For an additional $5 the donor will receive the 40th Anniversary catalog

All donors will receive confirmation of their donation for tax-deductible purposes via email.  

Prince Street Gallery is a non-profit 501C3, artist-organized gallery dedicated to exhibitions of  contemporary figurative and abstract artists. Now beginning its 47th year, the gallery is located at 530 West 25th Street, NYC (646) 230-0246   www.princestreetgallery.com

story:
About the project

Come with me! To the edge of the Invisible World, to the fringe of the dark, lush forests from our childhood, to the core of the enchanting valleys of our earliest excitement, down to the deepest of moors and bogs, while time keeps accomplishing its insidious task!

Come with me! Forever and ever along the adventurous trails of Dreamland!

Come with me! As the mists of dusk stretch over the land and the moon rises high, all plump and glistening. Run around the Faerie hills nine times counter-clockwise, take one step forward and…

…Come on in!

Jean-Baptiste Monge

The fantasy and Faery creatures of Jean-Baptiste Monge have been thrilling us for more than 20 years. His impish Gnomes, his big-shnozzed Goblins, grumpy Trolls and mischievous Fairies followed him to Canada to continue their tremendous story. In a studio much too small for his liking, Jean-Baptiste works on his personal projects and on the proper dissemination of his artwork with his partner Margo, under the infernal yoke of his two cats, Minus and Banana. Meanwhile, he also divides his time between different animation studios where his talent is put to good use as a Character Designer and Visual Development Artist.

Celtic Faeries - the book!

This book echoes back to my childhood and the bedtime stories my mother told us, stories often imbued with magic from the moorlands of Brittany where she was born, and where I spent part of my childhood and my life as an artist.

Celtic Faeries is a collection of stories and annotations that I’ve written, created, or sometimes refashioned from Victorian-era texts, about the fairytale creatures who populate the folklore of the “little” Celtic mythology. We are not concerned here with the ancient gods, but rather with the little folk and their magic.

The book is filled with full-color illustrations, and presented in a somewhat encyclopedic format, though by no means an exhaustive one. Within its pages, you will discover creatures that are funny, impish, mischievous, or grumpy in the extreme, as well as enchanting creatures of great beauty, some with diaphanous wings, and others that are just plain endearing. But beware: in Faerie, looks are often deceiving. Stay on your toes, for here, the line between good and evil is a veil so fine that a simple whisper in the air is sometimes enough to tear it.

In this book, you will find descriptions of the nature of Faeries, their connection to the animal world and, of course, some hints on the places they frequent, as well as the different ways to spot them, lure them, and keep them for your very own…

SPECIFICATIONS of Celtic Faeries:

The book is 24.5 x 33 cm and include 144 pages thanks to the Stretch Goals, meaning 40 pages in more than the French original version of 2007!

Thanks to the Stretch Goals we broke on the last Campaign we are very proud to tell that the Deluxe Edition comes now with:

  • rounded back to enhance the shape of the book
  • a glossy jacket to adorn its cover
  • endbands to reinforce the adhesive and finish the edge of the inside gatherings
  • a bookmark to ensure that you always find your page.
  • gilded pages
  • an elegant fabric style undercover with hot foiled title and design.
  • the possibility to choose with a magnificent slipcase in fabric style.

Language:

The book is available in English, a free PDF version comes automatically for each physical book bought + Jigsaw application for your tablet


Goblin's WAY

This is the name of the publishing house that I created with Margo in April 2013, and which Margo oversees full time and with great verve. Goblin’s WAY makes simple use of that little round bell that I’m so fond of, and that appears in almost all of my illustrations. It’s kind of my graphic signature. A little round bell is shiny, it makes a pretty sound, and you have to admit, it’s just too cute! On a more serious note, Goblin’s WAY is also a way to free myself of publishers and animation productions, and to be able to choose projects that I really want to work on. That freedom, so precious and vital to us artists, will allow me to create books exactly as I imagine them.

Why IndieGoGo ?

Our project was successfully funded on another crowdfunding platform and now is available with InDemand on this great platform.
Critically acclaimed on many blogs and media, Celtic FAERIES is now available in pre-order!
We decided to move on Indiegogo for those who miss Celtic Faeries and who still wanted the book.
We will use the platform for pre-orders, so there won't be new Stretch Goals.

Keep spreading the word to your friends and colleagues by sharing this info on all existing media – Twitter, Tumblr, Facebook, Instagram etc.

You are Fabulous!


Application Jigsaw puzzle for tablets for all the rewards!!


PRE-ORDER NOW your version of Celtic FAERIES!

Choose your Style!!


Perk $20 or more: 1 copy of the PDF version of Celtic Faeries.


Perk $80 or more: A copy of Celtic Faeries DELUXE Edition (Hardcover)


Perk $140 or more: A copy of Celtic Faeries DELUXE Edition comes with a sturdy and classy hot foil slipcase.


These Perks are for the pre-orders - we shall be ready around December 2016!


Testimonials

"JB Monge is a brilliant imagination and a link with the golden age of illustration. At once eminently modern and steeped in lore and tradition of centuries past. A worthy artist to support. I did!" - Guillermo del TORO

“Jean-Baptiste Monge has a rare and astonishing gift for capturing characters that magically transcend the page and leap to life. One wonders whether they are the product of his imagination or, as I like to believe, the visual diaries of an itinerant artist on vacation in the fairy realm.” - Paul TOBIN

About the shipping

More of my work - jbmonge.com

story_txt:
About the project



Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016 - Spectrum Silver Award 2009


Come with me! To the edge of the Invisible World, to the fringe of the dark, lush forests from our childhood, to the core of the enchanting valleys of our earliest excitement, down to the deepest of moors and bogs, while time keeps accomplishing its insidious task!
Come with me! Forever and ever along the adventurous trails of Dreamland!
Come with me! As the mists of dusk stretch over the land and the moon rises high, all plump and glistening.
Run around the Faerie hills nine times counter-clockwise, take one step forward and…
…Come on in!



Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016


Jean-Baptiste Monge
The fantasy and Faery creatures of Jean-Baptiste Monge have been thrilling us for more than 20 years. His impish Gnomes, his big-shnozzed Goblins, grumpy Trolls and mischievous Fairies followed him to Canada to continue their tremendous story. In a studio much too small for his liking, Jean-Baptiste works on his personal projects and on the proper dissemination of his artwork with his partner Margo, under the infernal yoke of his two cats, Minus and Banana. Meanwhile, he also divides his time between different animation studios where his talent is put to good use as a Character Designer and Visual Development Artist.
Celtic Faeries - the book!



Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016 - Spectrum Gold Award 2012


This book echoes back to my childhood and the bedtime stories my mother told us, stories often imbued with magic from the moorlands of Brittany where she was born, and where I spent part of my childhood and my life as an artist.

Celtic Faeries is a collection of stories and annotations that I’ve written, created, or sometimes refashioned from Victorian-era texts, about the fairytale creatures who populate the folklore of the “little” Celtic mythology. We are not concerned here with the ancient gods, but rather with the little folk and their magic.
The book is filled with full-color illustrations, and presented in a somewhat encyclopedic format, though by no means an exhaustive one. Within its pages, you will discover creatures that are funny, impish, mischievous, or grumpy in the extreme, as well as enchanting creatures of great beauty, some with diaphanous wings, and others that are just plain endearing. But beware: in Faerie, looks are often deceiving. Stay on your toes, for here, the line between good and evil is a veil so fine that a simple whisper in the air is sometimes enough to tear it.
In this book, you will find descriptions of the nature of Faeries, their connection to the animal world and, of course, some hints on the places they frequent, as well as the different ways to spot them, lure them, and keep them for your very own…
SPECIFICATIONS of Celtic Faeries:
The book is 24.5 x 33 cm and include 144 pages thanks to the Stretch Goals, meaning 40 pages in more than the French original version of 2007!
Thanks to the Stretch Goals we broke on the last Campaign we are very proud to tell that the Deluxe Edition comes now with:

rounded back to enhance the shape of the book
a glossy jacket to adorn its cover
endbands to reinforce the adhesive and finish the edge of the inside gatherings
a bookmark to ensure that you always find your page.
gilded pages
an elegant fabric style undercover with hot foiled title and design.

the possibility to choose with a magnificent slipcase in fabric style.

Language: 
The book is available in English, a free PDF version comes automatically for each physical book bought + Jigsaw application for your tablet






Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016





Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016


Goblin's WAY
This is the name of the publishing house that I created with Margo in April 2013, and which Margo oversees full time and with great verve. Goblin’s WAY makes simple use of that little round bell that I’m so fond of, and that appears in almost all of my illustrations. It’s kind of my graphic signature. A little round bell is shiny, it makes a pretty sound, and you have to admit, it’s just too cute! On a more serious note, Goblin’s WAY is also a way to free myself of publishers and animation productions, and to be able to choose projects that I really want to work on. That freedom, so precious and vital to us artists, will allow me to create books exactly as I imagine them.



Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016


Why IndieGoGo ?
Our project was successfully funded on another crowdfunding platform and now is available with InDemand on this great platform.Critically acclaimed on many blogs and media, Celtic FAERIES is now available in pre-order!We decided to move on Indiegogo for those who miss Celtic Faeries and who still wanted the book. We will use the platform for pre-orders, so there won't be new Stretch Goals.Keep spreading the word to your friends and colleagues by sharing this info on all existing media – Twitter, Tumblr, Facebook, Instagram etc. 
You are Fabulous!



Jean-Baptiste Monge (c) 2016



Application Jigsaw puzzle for tablets for all the rewards!!


PRE-ORDER NOW your version of Celtic FAERIES! 

Choose your Style!!

Perk $20 or more: 1 copy of the PDF version of Celtic Faeries.




Perk $80 or more: A copy of Celtic Faeries DELUXE Edition (Hardcover)




Perk $140 or more: A copy of Celtic Faeries DELUXE Edition comes with a sturdy and classy hot foil slipcase.



These Perks are for the pre-orders - we shall be ready around December 2016!

"JB Monge is a brilliant imagination and a link with the golden age of illustration. At once eminently modern and steeped in lore and tradition of centuries past. A worthy artist to support. I did!" - Guillermo del TORO
“Jean-Baptiste Monge has a rare and astonishing gift for capturing characters that magically transcend the page and leap to life. One wonders whether they are the product of his imagination or, as I like to believe, the visual diaries of an itinerant artist on vacation in the fairy realm.” - Paul TOBIN

story:
Overview

Hey everyone! This is a campaign to raise money to release my coffee table book "OH! THE HORROR!" I want to release this in May of 2021 and make sure everyone who wants one gets a copy but I need your help to make that happen!

Who am I? and What Is This Project?

My name is Chris Butler and I run the Etsy shop Chris Butler Designs. I design and sell alternate posters of some of your favorite horror films. Since I was a kid my 3 passions were music, graphic design and movies (with horror being my numero uno). 

I started my Etsy shop in October 2018 with 12 poster designs and have been overwhelmed by how much it has grown since. Now, with over 150 designs and 5,000 sales I have grown a small following on Instagram among fellow horror fiends like myself. I have had people reach out to me with pictures of entire walls in their homes covered top to bottom with my prints. I got to thinking "What about all the people that like my posters but don't have the wall space?" This lead me to make the decision to make a book. A book that would illustrate all my work.

Over the past year I worked endlessly on the layout. What size would it be? What would go where? How would I sort it? How many posters on each page? etc. I finally had a finished draft that was ready to print. When I received it in the mail my heart skipped a beat. I had not been that excited in a long time so I posted it on Instagram and Facebook. I received message after message from people who love my designs and wanted a copy! The comments and DM's kept pouring in so I decided I may have been onto something. 

I spent the next few months perfecting it. Adding in stories here and there. Throwing in autographed versions I have received (The Bruce Campbell one is my favorite.) This is not your typical book of designs. I am not just a horror poster designer. I am a horror fan. This is a book made by a horror fan FOR horror fans and I want to share it with whoever I can.

Risks & Challenges

I made the decision to not go through a publisher. I wanted to do this entirely by myself. A difficult task but most things worth doing are. By taking this on I have to handle getting these all printed and shipped by myself. I do this with posters every single day but a book is a bit of a different animal both in printing and shipping costs.

Because I am printing such a low quantity of these, the price per book is pricey. I had to balance finding a low enough price that also has the quality that I was looking for and supporters of my work have come to expect. I simply can not afford to print the quantity that I would like to to make sure that EVERYONE who wants one GETS ONE. This seemed like the best solution! If you would like a copy of this book NOW is the time to get one and I would love for you to be able to as I worked very hard to complete it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, sharing this page would be a huge help! I worked really hard over the past year to complete this book and I am so excited to share it with you!

story:
We are a group of twenty emerging documentary artists working to complete our Master of Fine Arts (MFA) degrees in Documentary Media at Ryerson University. The DocNow Festival is the culmination of two years of hard work, and an integral step in completing our degree: publicly showing our work.  We have a lot to say and look forward to the opportunity to say it!

This is the eleventh year of DocNow. Putting on a festival like this is a lot of work, and we have a lot to pay for. The good news is we have raised half the funds that we need to take DocNow into its second decade. Your sponsorship will help us close the deal and continue the tradition of excellence and free access to all events -- including film screenings, gallery installations, and more.

The largest portion of our budget pays for the theatres and galleries needed to show the work.  But there are other expenses, like speaker fees, film processing, web services, printing, advertising, catering, and so on. If we don't get all the funds needed, we will have to cut back on our schedule, and cut the other costs impacting the quality of the festival and access to it.

But this campaign is both give and take. We have perks that kick in at different contribution levels -- including priority seating at screening events, giveaways, artwork, and all of the above.

And there are even more ways you can help DocNow:

  • Follow us on Instagram and Twitter & Like Us on Facebook!
  • Join us in June 2018 at any of free our events!
  • Check out our past events on Vimeo

story:
Hi I'm J.C. Adams, entrepreneur, veteran burner and art car fanatic. During my first Burning Man, I fell in love with its amazing humans, the art and especially these “next level mutations” of machine and magic that help transport us and transform this dusty world into a vacation from planet earth. The next burn, some friends and I almost killed ourselves delivering an outrageous art car... and I’ve been doing it ever since.

This gift… a Burning Man art car… gives back. This is why myself and other amazing contributors have been bringing the Badillac for 9 years in a row now.

For spectators who watch the art cruise by, their reactions are always priceless. It creates smiles for miles. For participants who board the platform, start dancing, moving and grooving, transforming into their fabulously freaky selves, that’s when the art car fully comes alive. We become “part of the art”, and Badillac-ing around Black Rock City is magical.

There’s a long list of people who say this machine, its music and the playful adventures we take "made their burn". That list continues to grow and we should continue making those magical moments together.

Like most years, transporting the project to and from the Black Rock Desert is the biggest expenses, taking up right at half of this year’s cost. Other budget items include operations during burn (driver, fuel and mechanical support), lighting and sound, mechanical repairs, structural repairs and critical spare parts.

Of course there will be perks this year, "Playa Time" listed here. Have questions? Ready to schedule? Click “Ask A Question” link above. And get excited!

Should we do this? Hell yeah! THIS WILL BE BADILLAC’S 10 YEAR ANNIVERSARY!

Are there risks? You better believe it! Many of the beautiful art cars you’re admiring throughout the event... if ya look close... have some person working on it, or under it screaming WTF broke down this time??? It’s an extremely harsh environment for engines and electronics. Also, most art cars have been “sitting up” in storage all year without proper stress testing. And there’s no Black Rock Auto Parts Camp... yet.

There were 2 years Badillac had major mechanical failures on the Playa, but our superhero team patched her up. Each year this 1969 Detroit built Cadillac reaches deep and pushes through all week, through to temple burn. She’s the workhorse that delivers year after year.

Can you do your part? Please donate to Badillac. Maybe you want the perks? I guarantee it’s worth it.

If now is not a good time, I certainly understand. PLEASE CLICK THE SHARE LINKS ABOVE sending to a fellow burner who can contribute and may want these perks!  

Want to volunteer? Click “Ask A Question” link above.

Lots of love to you all. Safe journeys HOME.  I can’t wait to see you, covered in dust, creating magic and celebrating life like you mean it  !!!

<3 JC

story:
Who

The Second Story Art Society operating as TRUCK Contemporary Art in Calgary is a non-profit artist-run centre dedicated to the development and public presentation of contemporary art. Since it was founded in 1983 the Society has facilitated over 450 exhibitions in addition to countless activities and events in support of cultural development and contemporary art appreciation. Currently, TRUCK hosts 18 exhibitions annually in its two exhibition venues, and various collaborative events and activities with other arts groups and nonprofit organizations.

TRUCK is dedicated to the presentation of contemporary art. Our goal is to incite dialogue locally, which contributes to the global critical discourse on contemporary art.

TRUCK's primary activities in support of this mission are:

    • To present dynamic programming

    • To foster innovative artistic practices

    • To encourage experimentation

    • To engage artists and the public in a discussion about the art form

TRUCK is dedicated to the advancement of contemporary art by committing to the following values:

    • Artist-centered

    • Diversity

    • Self-determination

    • Collaboration

 

What

Since the early 1990s, conceptual artist James Luna has worked collaboratively on an ongoing project titled The Shame-man meets El Mexican't, in which the assumptions and lazy thinking about ethnicity and culture in our society is challenged with a strong dose of melancholic humor and sharp-edged conceptualism. Currently touring nationally, the project uses nostalgia as style, a form of resistance and reinvention, exploring the cultural, symbolic and iconographic dimensions of “nostalgia” both on the Native American "rez" and in the Chicano "barrio." The artists participating in this performance are highly regarded in the national and international arts arena. James Luna (Puyukitchum/Luiseno) resides on the La Jolla Indian Reservation in North County San Diego, California. Luna’s exhibition and performance experience spans 30 years. His installations have been described as transforming gallery spaces into battlefields, where the audience is confronted with the nature of cultural identity, the tensions generated by cultural isolation, and the dangers of cultural misinterpretations, all from an Indigenous perspective. Local Calgary based performance artist Terrance Houle will participate as part of this dynamic performance as an invited guest. Terrance Houle is an internationally recognized interdisciplinary media artist and a member of the Blood Tribe. Involved with Aboriginal communities all his life, he has traveled to reservations throughout North America participating in Powwow dancing along with his native ceremonies. Houle utilizes at his discretion performance, photography, video/film, music and painting. Likewise Houle's practice includes tools of mass dissemination such as billboards and vinyl bus signage. His Works have been exhibited across Canada, in parts of the United States, Australia, China, Europe, and England.

Where

These artists will present this Performance in Calgary at the EPCOR CENTRE for the Performing Arts. In addition to their performance James Luna will hold a Master's Class. This workshop will bring together Indigenous artists of diverse socio-political contexts, from the Calgary First Nations community, including Treaty 7 Nation members and Metis and Inuit artists, as well as James Luna from the La Jolla nation of Southern California, and Latin-American artist Gomez-Pena. This project will provide a platform for the exploration, discussion, and critique of divergent Aboriginal performance and new media practices in Calgary. With these artists and other members of the Calgary First Nations community, we will explore a new dialogue of art creation that will give voice to Indigenous arts and culture, which has been historically lacking in the Calgary area.

How

We are seeking matching funding to fully fund the performance and Master Class Workshop by these internationally acclaimed artists. The funds will go directly to support the artists, provide technical support for the performance and workshop, as well as provide free admission to workshop participants and audiences for the performance. We are dedicated to enriching the cultural landscape of our community and removing barriers to the public experience of contemporary art.


This project is being produced in partnership with the Inidigeneity Aboriginal Artist Collective Society, the EPCOR CENTRE For the Performing Arts, the Mountain Standard Time Performative Art Festival Society, and TRUCK Contemporary Art in Calgary. Each of these organizations is committed to making this project happen in Calgary, free to the public. TRUCK will match the funding raised for this project to help offset the costs of the performance and Master Class. All of the organizations partnering in this initiative committed to providing access to this exceptional event through our operational funding and cash reserves. All of the funding for this project will go towards travel assistance, accommodations, artist fees and production support for this event. 

Other ways you can help

Please pass along this wonderful opportunity to expand the critical dialogue on contemporary art in Calgary.  Feel free to share this post with as many people as you can and help us achieve our goal to bring these exciting and amazing artists to Calgary.

All of the funding for this project will go towards travel assistance, accommodations, artist fees and production support for this event.

story:
Hello all. My name is Talia Johnson and I am an eleventh grader here in Seattle. Recently I came in to a once in a lifetime chance to visit Ethiopia and volunteer at the Richard Oslund Memorial Clinic on the outskirts of Addis Ababa. This clinic was founded, built and is operated by Blue Nile Children's Organization (BNCO), a non-profit based out of Seattle. One of my tasks there will be to organize and run a three week long art camp for HIV orphans sponsered by BNCO. 

August in Addis is very rainy and the children don't have school. The crafts I will be making with them will engage their creativity as well as become a functional object. I will be letting them design and create their own wearable art in the form of t-shirt we will be repurposing in many ways.  The children do not have many clothes of their own and by giving them creative free reign, I hope to give them a real sense of ownership of self and mind, along with just having fun!

What I Need

What I need most at this point is funding for the art supplies used at the camp. I will need to buy most of these products in the US before I fly over as there is a huge scarcity. I will need dyes for the tye-dying project, sponges, a large array of fabric paint, felting wool, white t-shirts of all sizes, etc.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have and any of the above (specifically) listed supplies and would be willing to donate them instead of cash, PLEASE CONTACT ME BEFORE JULY 29TH. I fly out on the 30th so anything donated after that date will be unused. 

If you can't spare any thing at the moment, please spread the word instead! The more people know about my project and the wonderful work the Blue Nile Children's Organization does, the better!

I will be keeping a blog (URL TBA) chronicling my work at the clinic as well. Photos of the art camp and its lively participants will of course be posted regularly. Feel free to contact me with any other questions and inquires.

Thank you and have a wonderful day. 

 

http://www.bluenile.org/

http://www.bluenile.org/category/clinic/

 

You might also want to also check out the two blog of two college students who recently spent their winter quarter of this year volunteering at the Richard Oslund Memorial Clinic (links below)

http://ninaboal.tumblr.com/

http://emilyinet.tumblr.com/
story_txt:
Hello all. My name is Talia Johnson and I am an eleventh grader here in Seattle. Recently I came in to a once in a lifetime chance to visit Ethiopia and volunteer at the Richard Oslund Memorial Clinic on the outskirts of Addis Ababa. This clinic was founded, built and is operated by Blue Nile Children's Organization (BNCO), a non-profit based out of Seattle. One of my tasks there will be to organize and run a three week long art camp for HIV orphans sponsered by BNCO. 
August in Addis is very rainy and the children don't have school. The crafts I will be making with them will engage their creativity as well as become a functional object. I will be letting them design and create their own wearable art in the form of t-shirt we will be repurposing in many ways.  The children do not have many clothes of their own and by giving them creative free reign, I hope to give them a real sense of ownership of self and mind, along with just having fun!
What I Need


What I need most at this point is funding for the art supplies used at the camp. I will need to buy most of these products in the US before I fly over as there is a huge scarcity. I will need dyes for the tye-dying project, sponges, a large array of fabric paint, felting wool, white t-shirts of all sizes, etc.
 
Other Ways You Can Help


If you have and any of the above (specifically) listed supplies and would be willing to donate them instead of cash, PLEASE CONTACT ME BEFORE JULY 29TH. I fly out on the 30th so anything donated after that date will be unused. 
If you can't spare any thing at the moment, please spread the word instead! The more people know about my project and the wonderful work the Blue Nile Children's Organization does, the better!
I will be keeping a blog (URL TBA) chronicling my work at the clinic as well. Photos of the art camp and its lively participants will of course be posted regularly. Feel free to contact me with any other questions and inquires.
Thank you and have a wonderful day. 
 
http://www.bluenile.org/
http://www.bluenile.org/category/clinic/
 
You might also want to also check out the two blog of two college students who recently spent their winter quarter of this year volunteering at the Richard Oslund Memorial Clinic (links below)
http://ninaboal.tumblr.com/
http://emilyinet.tumblr.com/

story:
Short Summary

I first created the Fellowship of the Fool Tarot deck while I was a student in Goddard College's MFA program. I have long loved the Tarot and have been teaching and reading the cards for over 20 years. Since 2009, I have been self-publishing the deck in several different forms. I hope to find a publisher to publish the deck, but until then, I am getting loads of requests from people all over the world for decks! I would love to be able to keep it in circulation, and the money raised from this campaign will help me do just that. 

The Fellowship of the Fool Tarot is a multi-cultural deck featuring people from all walks of life. The deck is based on real people from my own communities, and is very magickal, featuring faeries, unicorns, and magickal beings of all kinds. It is also a unique reflection of the Pagan community in the 21st century. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

With the Funds raised, I would get 1000 decks printed, as well as books to go with the decks. If you help me out, here's what you'll get:


Donate $15  and receive a matted and signed print.


Donate $40 and receive a signed copy of the Fellowship of the Fool Tarot and a signed print.

 

Donate $60 and you'll receive a print, a signed copy of the Fellowship of the Fool Tarot and a signed copy of the accompanying book.


Donate $100 and you'll receive the print, the deck, the book, and a reading over email with me! 

If I don't reach the full goal, I will still go ahead with the printing, I will probably not print as many. 

 

The Impact

My first printing of the deck was very successful - I sold out all 100 of the first copies I had printed. By printing 1000, I can distribute the deck wider than I have before!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help out by posting about my campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Tell your friends!!!

story:
New club T-Shirts for the gang :)

Who are the Painting Pirates Club? (PPC)

    The Painting Pirates Club was started 5 months ago in La Paz Baja California South, Mexico. We have been introducing street art to the children and adults in some of the disadvantaged areas in the city, and will shortly be showing Latin American films and documentaries in Spanish.

    We teach the locals about another type of expression 'Artistic expression'. Art is not politics or ethics, it is a gray area of discussion, a place that allows us to think. We believe that by giving these people, the children in particular, the opportunity to express themselves and learn about other Mexican and Latin American artists you are giving them hope for their future.

    The Painting Pirates Club is teaching free expression in a 2.5km long concrete river, we are painting on both sides of the river walls, the mural will be 5Km long. We now have between 15 to 30 people painting in the PPC, giving the residents of the 'Arroyo de concreto in el esterito' a unique opportunity to paint the walls of their neighborhood and to belong to their own club.


The Painting Pirates Club is run by the nonprofit Quintessence Project.Org (QPO)

Our short term project is to continue teaching free expression in disadvantaged areas.

Our mid term project is to show Latin American films and documentaries to disadvantaged areas and teach them to film and make their own documentaries.

Our long term project is to teach free expression in the schools, hospitals, the prison, and the battered women shelter in La Paz.

Our over all goal is to teach people that they can make an income through art, and expression through art is good for them psychologically, physically, economically.


The Drug and alcohol Problems

The people we are teaching in La Paz have their origins in the Yaquis tribe. The Yaquis immigrated to Baja from main land Mexico, Senora, before the revolution of 1910. They are native Americans who have been in La Paz for generations. They came here to fish and dive for pearls. They were adept at holding their breath and were a great profit to La Paz at the time.
They have been left behind in the booming tourist industry. Many of the fishermen turned to the tourist industry as a new income, by taking the tourists out to see the whale sharks and sea-lionsâ€¦ The Yaquis have been socially excluded. Some say it's because of their alcohol and drug abuse problems "They do it to themselves". Some conspiracy theorists would say the CIA drug cartel targets certain disadvantaged areas to import and distribute to the drug market. What ever the reason might be, pointing fingers, will not change the situation one iota. The Yaquis children have a full understanding of drugs and the distribution of them. In the Arroyo I often smell meth cooking up.
The future of these kids seem to be written and most of them would agree with that. In fact I often see 'No Fate' tagged on the walls.
The fisherman are renowned to work hard all day then come home tired and drink alcohol. The women traditionally raise the children, but recently to keep up with the times have started to work. With a high rate of illiteracy not many women can find work in the fast evolving La Paz, many turn to prostitution.



A proud Pirate holding up his sister.

In this video you see Valentines day with the Painting Pirates:
http://youtu.be/k0HF0TIh2DU

How are you helping by donating?

1) By teaching this people to express themselves you are giving them the courage to go after their dreams. One small nudge in the right direction.  

2) The media coverage helps them to feel a sense of self-worth.
The elitist social circles, which have grown out of the tourist industry, don't like the undesirables disturbing the tourists. Most of the disadvantaged and poor people stick primarily to their ghettos which the tourists are advised not to go to.

3) You inspire the kids to believe, by being involved and belonging to their own club.
When your father is out of the job, or is working several jobs for hardly any money, it is easy to assume that no matter how hard you work, because for where you come from, you will never achieve your dream... so why try? Many of the kids I paint with sniff glue and take other drugs; when you give them something else to do for 6 hours, it makes a difference.

By funding this project you are giving them hope, making a difference in their lives and brightening up their world.



I have added two interviews from people who live in El Esterito to give you a better idea about the disadvantaged areas the PPC is working in.

Jose Maria Arse Ortega


   Jose never asked his farther where his family came from before La Paz. He conceders himself Native to Baja Sur. He is a Pascadore Libre (free fisherman) who has worked for a private corporation for 30 years. I asked Jose how long the drug problems have been in el Esterito? Jose - "15 years, before that there were no drug problems. Now the children sniff glue, and cook Meth amphetamine." I asked him what he thought about the Painting Pirates Club? Jose - "It's very good for the children, since so many fathers lost their jobs the children have no one to teach them about the old ways, fishing and diving are not an opportunity for them. When they paint they learn much more then spending their day taking drugs. The kids are proud of the paintings, they show their painting to their families, they don't want anyone to graffiti over their paintings as it belongs to them." I asked Jose if there was anything he would like to add in this article? Jose - "To Love the sea, care and appreciate for the sea, in stead of drugs. I hope the children can go fish for free like before."


Jose Maria Arse Ortega (Top right holding the fish)

 
Betty

Betty is the owner of a fish and seafood restaurant in El Arroyo Concreto, her family has lived in El Estrerito for generations. Her farther and husband were fishermen. She is a single mother of 4 daughters. As a child Betty would go door to door selling her farther's daily catch. She now owns her own restaurant, which she runs with one of her daughters.
You could defiantly consider Betty and her daughters a success story coming from El Arroyo Concreto. She and her daughters can read and write and have jobs in La Paz.

I asked her what she thought of the schooling system in La Paz?
Betty - "The Children go to school from 8h to 13h, they do not learn much at school. It is up to the parents to make sure their children learn. Most fathers are tired after fishing and the mothers are mostly illiterate. After the age of 12 most of the children don't go to school any more."

I asked what the children did all day if they don't go to school?
Betty - "The Children turn to drugs, prostitution and cock fighting for easy money. This results in sexual deceases and drug addition. One of my daughters became addicted to meth, I took her to a detox home and we got her un-addicted which was horrible to go through and very hard for my daughter. At the time we had a detox home in La Paz, it was free to go to."

I asked how she thought the people in El Esterito were holding up against the booming tourist industry?
Betty - "The People living in El Esterito live day to day, the people haven't had time to learn how to get a job in tourism. They are lazy and conformist and they have no confidence in themselves. The government is corrupt."

I asked Betty what she thought the Painting Pirates Club has done for the people here? Betty - "It's good, what you are doing for the children. Their mothers is gone or working, their farther are drunk and tired, so the children turn to vandalism. You have brought art and culture, the children have confidence in you, you have made the children proud of the paintings they do." 

I asked Betty if she wanted to add any thing to the article?
Betty - "Yes!! Come to eat at Betty's! The freshest fish in all of Baja!" she said with a cunning grin and then she added "Love your colony, it is important that the colony gets organized, to understand the paperwork and the politics."

Betty is the President of the Colony in El Arroyo Concreto, she often organizes free celebrations for the people in her restaurant.



Maggie and Sara and Serio's home. 3 children and both parents live in this small one room house. All the kids sleep in one single bed.

Don't forget to look through the perks we're offering
the $20 perk is one for our T-shirts with hand printed logo
with $20 we can buy 5 gallons of paint.



This is the Medium V-neck T-shirt and the small Tank top with hand printed PPC logo :)
100% cotton in Sizes S,M,L,XL



Cintiha painting, the name of a donator 'Richard Shannon' who asked for the 'Your name up in paint' the $30 perk.

In this video you see the children painting 'Your name up in paint':
http://youtu.be/pA8xtZnXXak
Please donate and help us fund this great project. 


Join our facebook page and follow our progress.

Thank you for your time
