story:
Hello! My name is Autumn!

You may know me from my instagram @autumnlabarbera where I post my cosplay. If you haven't checked it out, you definitely should to get more context for my campaign. I'm a struggling art student with a true passion for cosplaying along with many other nerdy things. Bringing my favorite characters to life makes me more happy than anything in this world and I love that I've been able to be a part of something so wonderful this long. Unfortunately costumes, props, and conventions can get quite expensive. That's where you come in! If you love this stuff as much as I do and want to be a part of the cosplay magic then please make a donation! Every little bit counts as I gear up for Los Angeles Comic Con! My main goal is to debut two brand new cosplays and two revamp my Mary Jane cosplay that you all know and love and in the future open a print store. I can't wait to create new and amazing things for you guys! Thank you so much for your support it truly means the world. Love, Autumn

story:
CHI SIAMO

Il nostro progetto nasce dal parternariato tra l’associazione Perda Sonadora di Seneghe e la Cooperativa Sociale CTR di Cagliari e consiste nella pubblicazione di un libro di testi poetici prodotti all’interno del laboratorio “La casa della poesia” ,condotto dalle poetesse Azzurra D’Agostino e Francesca Matteoni e rivolto a persone in condizioni di disagio psichico.

Perda Sonadora, attraverso l’animazione culturale e sociale, ha come obiettivo la valorizzazione del proprio patrimonio storico, culturale e artistico finalizzata a un confronto maturo con il mondo contemporaneo e la realtà esterna. La cooperativa sociale Comunicazione Territorio Relazioni è articolata in diverse aree d'intervento socio-sanitario, ma questo progetto nasce specificamente dall’area dell’intervento per la Salute Mentale e vede coinvolti quattro servizi di cui tre strutture residenziali per persone in condizione di disagio psichico e un servizio diurno a struttura sovracomunale rivolto alla stessa tipologia di utenza, tutti collocati ad Oristano e provincia. 

IL LIBRO

Il libro avrà come titolo “Un ponte gettato sul mare” e costituirà la raccolta di tutta la produzione laboratoriale, circa 200 poesie. Gli autori sono persone con serie compromissioni della sfera affettiva e relazionale e bisognosi di interventi terapeutici ad alta protezione sanitaria e sociale insieme ai loro Educatori professionali e Operatori Socio Sanitari. In tutto 18 persone.

Le poesie saranno accompagnate da illustrazioni, anch’esse realizzate da uno degli ospiti di una struttura psichiatrica.

Il libro verrà presentato al festival “L’importanza di essere piccoli “ad agosto 2016 sull’Appennino tosco emiliano. Sarà questo un modo per andare oltre i confini e riattraversare quel ponte creato tra l’isola e la terra ferma. La raccolta verrà inoltre presentata al prossimo Cabudanne de sos poetas a Seneghe e deve essere pubblicato entro la metà di luglio.

PERCHE’ FINANZIARLO

Inutile dire che questo libro ha una forte valenza sociale e culturale.  Un ponte gettato sul mare vuole superare le barriere e gli stereotipi culturali legati alla malattia mentale, vuole contribuire a un cambiamento nel pensare e affrontare il disagio psichico così diffuso nel mondo contemporaneo. Un ponte gettato sul mare nasce da un laboratorio in cui “normalità” e “anormalità” non hanno costituito criteri di analisi o categorie di lettura validi.

Insieme “pazienti” e “operatori” hanno guardato e tradotto in versi emozioni, sguardi, ricordi e tutti si sono trovati a scoprire una modalità espressiva comune di cui nessuno era esperto, in cui gli inevitabili rapporti di potere si annullavano.

Forse questo è il valore maggiore di questa produzione artistica: a parità di “incompetenza”, tutti siamo messi a nudo allo stesso modo, con le stesse difficoltà personali; ma è proprio dalla comune incompetenza che ci si può reciprocamente “curare”.

Regaliamolo a tutti quelli che credono nella reciproca cura!

story:
Hello, my name is Riana Casas, and I am a recent college graduate from the College of Saint Rose in Albany, NY. I received my Bachelors in Fine Arts concentrating in Painting and Printmaking, with minors in Art History and Psychology in May 2014. Getting a job in the arts field is something that I have to admit, I wasn't quite prepared for in my previous schooling. Although I did get a job as a Gallery Attendant at Dia:Beacon and juggle waitressing while waiting for an opportunity to arise in which I can make art, or find a way into the art world. Residencies are the vehicle on which artists make the journey across the art world bridge that separates themselves from the galleries, and making a difference. Therefore, receiving a residency out of college is a big deal. Today, I found out that I was accepted into the Vermont Studio Center for a printmaking residency with some grant money and work exchange. I received a residency, AND I am being given some aid to help the residency occur. However, I do not make much money at the museum and waitressing combined and really need some help raising money to make my first big step into being an art student and a working professional artist! The remainder of my bill is $2,500 for a month in the Green Mountains, Johnson, Vermont. Therefore, this page will hopefully help me raise a majority of this remainder! This contribution would be making a dream come true, and giving this emerging artist my first big break. 


Now, that you know the nitty gritty number of it all, I would like to explain what this money will go towards other than making it possible for me to attend my first residency program. This money will go towards housing, meals, and supplies. I will continue working as hard as I can to earn the money on my end, but there is only so much you can save on two hourly part time jobs. The contributions will aid me to work through new printmaking goals and installation work that I cannot make in my studio at home. I do not own a printing press, making it very difficult to print anything at home, unless it is hand printed. In addition, the materials provided at the Vermont Studo Center will be far superior than the materials I have been using currently including inks, rollers, and the press itself. 
If you can't contribute yourself, spreading the word would be just as helpful! I need my fundraiser to get the attention necessary, and spreading the message can't hurt the cause! Share my indiegogo!

story:
My zombie portraits of Google employees hang in the Google Office in Toronto.

ABOUT ME

I am the artist known online as Byron "von" Rempel (and sometimes the Zombie Master or Lord of the Horde)!  I am a self-taught professional artist well known for my zombies, zombie portraits and cat paintings. Over one hundred of my zombie portraits hang on the wall at the Google Canada office in Toronto, and in homes around the world. You can find out more in interviews by Forbes.com, Global National and the National Post.

For years people have wanted books of my artwork, and so I have put ebook collections together before, but now I want to get in to physical books. So it's time to get my feet wet in the book making process.  I'm creating a sketchbook of paintings and drawings for this project and I want user input on what should be inside.

I'm also a huge fan of seeing the sketchier side of my favorite artists, so I thought this would be fun.

I need your help getting funded so that I can cover my costs of printing a first run of these sketchbooks. 

The Sketchbook

8" X 10" Perfect Bound Paperback
Full Color interior
Glossy Full Color Cover

80 full color pages of my sketches and drawings made just for this project and additional extra pages if stretch goals are achieved.

An example of what some pages could look like


What I Need, and Perks!

I would like to do an initial printing run of 100 books, which will cost approximately $850 to get printed via createspace.com and another $150 or so to ship them to me and at least $500 or so to ship them out to everyone that orders them. (the or so is because the total shipping hasn't been completely figured out.)

The remaining money will be used for art supplies, sketchbook, prints and unforseen costs as well as indiegogo fees.

Once the books are printed, signed copies will be available at www.byronjrempel.com and unsigned copies available through amazon.com or createspace.com. 

Only books ordered through the indiegogo campaign will have any stretch goal bonus pages.

Another sample page including a sample of the SKETCHBOOK PORTRAIT perk


I am offering a few funding tiers with perks for your contribution:

  • $10 - EBOOK
    Thanks for supporting the campaign!  You get my heartfelt gratitude for being awesome! And when the book is put together, you get the ebook version.

    All perks $10 or more also include the ebook,

  • $27 - SKETCHBOOK!
    You will receive an unsigned copy of the sketchbook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project.  This includes the cost of shipping withttps://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/byron-rempel-s-sket... Canada and the US. International contributors please add $10 for shipping.

  • $40 - EARLY BIRD SKETCHBOOK!!
    You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project. This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within Canada and the US.  International contributors please add $10 for shipping.
    Only 5 available

  • $50 - SKETCHBOOK PLUS!!!
    You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project, PLUS an 8x10 print of your choice. This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International please add $12 for shipping.

  • $100 - SKETCHBOOK SKETCH!!!!
    • You will receive a signed copy of the sketchBook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project, PLUS an 8x10 print of your choice AND I will do a full sketch on the inside from cover of your book. You can even suggest the theme of the sketch.This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International please add $12 for shipping.
    Only 10 available.

  • $125 - SKETCHBOOK PORTRAIT!!!!!
    You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project, PLUS an 8x10 print of your choice AND I will do a full sketch on the inside from cover of your book. You can even suggest the theme of the sketch. This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International please add $10 for shipping.
    Only 8 available.

  • $150 - SKETCHBOOK PAGE!!!!!!
    You decide on the theme for one of the pages in the sketchbook, and get an 8x10 print of that page. You will also receive a signed copy of the sketchbook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project, PLUS an 8x10 print of your choice and a full sketch on the inside front cover of your book. You can also suggest the theme of that sketch too. This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International please add $10 for shipping.
    Only 10 available.

  • $1000 -the SKETCHBOOK!!!!!!
    You can own the original SKETCHBOOK containing the original 80 full color painted pages and all the other doodles that are on the reverse sides. This will also have the original custom painted cover and a custom inside fully painted front cover too. You can even suggest the theme for that painting.
    You will also receive a signed copy of the sketchbook containing all 80 pages and any stretch goal pages made just for this project.


STRETCH GOALS!

If the campaign gets fully funded and beyond, I have some great ideas for stretch goals including bookmarks, extra pages just for indiegogo backers and more!
I will update the stretch goals section once the original goal is met.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my sketchbook!

Thanks for checking out my indiegogo campaign!

story:
The Olympia Sync Summit

On the weekend of August 8th Sync Book Press is organizing The 2014 Olympia Sync Summit.

This event will feature...

- A live Radio8Ball Show with The Radio8Band & (Celebrity Guest - TBD).
- A tour of the "Kabbalistic Tree of Olympia" (from the book "Accidental Initiations" by Andras Jones)

& presentations from...

- Alan Green (Sync Book Press)
- Rodney Ascher (Room 237)
- Joe Alexander (Apophenia Productions)
- Frater X (Middle Chamber)
- Marty Leeds (MatheMagic)
- Will Morgan (42 Minutes)
- Scott Onstott (Secrets in Plain Sight)
- James Evan Pilato (Media Monarchy)
- David Plate (MKUltrasound)
- Ezra Sandzer-Bell (Tone Color Alchemy)
- Michael Schacht (Gosporn)
- Andras Jones (Radio8Ball)
AND MORE TO BE ANNOUNCED

But mostly, it's an opportunities to enjoy sync in a magickal town at the most beautiful time of year, in a state where pot and gay marriage are legal, and the death penalty isn't.

We are raising funds to cover travel expenses for our presenters.

In order to produce the best event possible we need great presenters and even those who are willing to contribute their talents and insight for free, still need help with their travel and lodging.

The funds we are raising will cover these costs. Anything left over will pay to document the event so those who are unable to attend will still be able to enjoy the event.

Synchronicity!

If the experience of synchronicity inspires you, then you're like us, and we'd like to meet you in Olympia this summer. Your participation in this campaign will make it a reality we can all share.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and loved ones who dig sync.

story:
Short Summary

With our annual event, Fine Art: Five Cents, we are creating access to fine art on the cheap (in the form of both music and visual art) while at the same time raising money for great causes. We will have artist booths, local bands, and the advantage of Congress' full bar! Read on, or check out our Facebook and website listed below for more details.



What We Need & What You Get

We need: $500 to provide for the costs leading up to our 2nd annual Fine Art: Five Cents event on November 14th at Hotel Congress in downtown Tucson. All funds raised from the pre-sale (and any additional monies above what we're asking for) will be used to enhance the event and provide more money for this year's cause.

You Get: With your pre-sale purchase or donation, you will receive the perk of your choice, listed on the right side of this page. You also get the knowledge that you helped support a great cause!


    The Impact

    Last year, we raised several thousand dollars for Child's Play charity (a huge success!) With your pre-sale purchase, we can maximize the proceeds from Fine Art: Five Cents, and in turn provide more support for the cause.

    This year, we are raising money for Downtown Radio-Tucson, a low power FM radio station that is dedicated to bringing a new, non-commercial, community-sponsored rock n' roll radio station to the general downtown area.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that not everyone will be able to participate in the pre-sale, but you can still help by volunteering your time toward helping us spread the word!

story:
Livestream Link! http://www.twitch.tv/huebr1s/

Hi.
My name is Julian Elwood and I want to be a Concept Artist. 
Now some people don't know what that entails when I say that so let me elaborate.
Concept artists design things, they design the tables and chairs of a set, the swords and shields of the warriors, the vehicles of the civilization. Concept artists design worlds.

So here is some info about myself.

I've wanted to be an artist for most of my life, I just graduated high school and am currently going to community college for an arts degree. I am an avid gamer, my favorite games currently range from Journey, And Superbrothers: Sword and Sworcery to Diablo 3 and the Mass Effect trilogy. Good books and making things are always on my To Do lists. My goal is to attend Art Center of Pasadena and take me into a career. A Dream job of mine is to be a concept artist for a major video game developer or several. It would be amazing to design fantastical worlds and have people later experience those worlds through video games. The works of people like Alan Lee and Kekai Kotaki have inspired me, and I have been working hard at refining my skills.


Here you can see my current portfolio of concept art, studies and graphic design.
https://www.behance.net/Cirque_7 

Here is my Deviant Art page, with a little more of my random works.
http://xii-tru7h-vi.deviantart.com/gallery/?offset=0 


Now that you have a little back story, 
I believe that one of these -http://www.wacom.com/en/us/creative/cintiq-13-hd
would greatly bolster my work to a more professional level. The digital medium is essential to concept artists in this age and I would love to push my work to another level with a good tablet. Unfortunately I cannot afford both going to school, and the tool set I need :( 
So please just hit that share button, so that I can spread my campaign to as many people as possible and even better, purchase some of my work! 
With my reward levels you can purchase some of my work such as:
-wallpapers
-custom concept drawings and paintings

-custom digital paintings
 And help me reach my goal to continue doing what I love. 

Like my art on facebook for all of my artistic updates!
https://www.facebook.com/elwoodvii


http://www.twitch.tv/huebr1s/ Link to the livestream channel! 
9AM-9AM March 1st-2nd


Thanks for looking at my page!
story_txt: Livestream Link! http://www.twitch.tv/huebr1s/Hi.My name is Julian Elwood and I want to be a Concept Artist. Now some people don't know what that entails when I say that so let me elaborate.Concept artists design things, they design the tables and chairs of a set, the swords and shields of the warriors, the vehicles of the civilization. Concept artists design worlds.So here is some info about myself.I've wanted to be an artist for most of my life, I just graduated high school and am currently going to community college for an arts degree. I am an avid gamer, my favorite games currently range from Journey, And Superbrothers: Sword and Sworcery to Diablo 3 and the Mass Effect trilogy. Good books and making things are always on my To Do lists. My goal is to attend Art Center of Pasadena and take me into a career. A Dream job of mine is to be a concept artist for a major video game developer or several. It would be amazing to design fantastical worlds and have people later experience those worlds through video games. The works of people like Alan Lee and Kekai Kotaki have inspired me, and I have been working hard at refining my skills.Here you can see my current portfolio of concept art, studies and graphic design.https://www.behance.net/Cirque_7 Here is my Deviant Art page, with a little more of my random works.http://xii-tru7h-vi.deviantart.com/gallery/?offset=0 Now that you have a little back story, I believe that one of these -http://www.wacom.com/en/us/creative/cintiq-13-hdwould greatly bolster my work to a more professional level. The digital medium is essential to concept artists in this age and I would love to push my work to another level with a good tablet. Unfortunately I cannot afford both going to school, and the tool set I need :( So please just hit that share button, so that I can spread my campaign to as many people as possible and even better, purchase some of my work! With my reward levels you can purchase some of my work such as:-wallpapers-custom concept drawings and paintings-custom digital paintings And help me reach my goal to continue doing what I love. Like my art on facebook for all of my artistic updates!https://www.facebook.com/elwoodviihttp://www.twitch.tv/huebr1s/ Link to the livestream channel! 9AM-9AM March 1st-2ndThanks for looking at my page!

story:
Introduction

The Breathing Peace mural campaign emerged from my experience of creating my first mural in the Patterson Park community of Baltimore. The intention of this mural was to connect the diverse community while sharing a message of unity, peace and respect for the land. Now it is my goal to share the Breathing Peace message that was created in Baltimore with communities in South and Central America.  

I am a self-taught artist and discovered my passion for visual arts in 2010. I am a native of Uruguay and currently live in Baltimore where I am active in the art community. I believe art offers a universal language that stimulates ideas, dialogue and action for social change.

How you can Support

We are deeply grateful for your support and belief in this project. The goal is to raise $4,500 by March 2014. The materials for each mural will cost an average of $1,000 and the majority of your donation will go directly to purchase supplies and the remainder to cover living expenses. The goal is to paint 4 to 5 murals, but there is no limit, so with your support Breathing Peace murals can grow beyond the current series. Should we raise more than our campaign goal, additional murals will be created for other communities.

By donating you will receive a perk (gift) that will directly connect you to the project including original sketches from the artist, poster, stickers and postcards of the murals.

The Impact

Murals are a powerful medium to inspire and transform public spaces. They provide visual stimulation to break the monotony of the urban landscape and create a common ground for the community to realize their shared values. The Breathing Peace murals will convey an honest, harmless, and positive message to connect communities to their innate potential. Through this project, Pablo hopes to use art as a tool to build and inspire a sense of collective responsibility, encouraging people to take ownership of their space while building confidence in their collective action

Breathing Peace is a community-centered project that will grow organically and adapt to the needs of the neighborhood. The designs for the murals will be co-created with the communities, and each mural will build capacity for both the community and the Breathing Peace project. 

"The only treasure that survives after death is all that we have given." 

~ Aymara oral tradition 

Other Ways You Can Help …

Follow us on Facebook La Abuela Street Art, tell your friends, and share the message of Breathing Peace. Please contact us directly by email: laabuelastreetart@gmail.com if you have resources or suggestions for the project, including requests for murals in your community.

story:
Hi there, before telling you what I need let me tell you who I am:

I am Jean Paul Gomez; I grew up in Bogota, Colombia, where I studied visual arts at the National University of Colombia. After moving to the United States, I studied at the University of Central Florida, where I received a Bachelor in fine arts with emphasis on photography. In 2013 I received a Master of Fine Arts degree from the Pratt Institute of New York. My work has been exhibited in numerous galleries and art fairs including United Photo Industries, Governors Island Art Fair, ED. Varie Gallery, The Fountain Art Fair NY, among others.  After graduating, I concentrated on making artworks and connections, and have been awarded various art residencies around the world, including the Arteles Creative Centre in Finland, and Campos de Gutierres in Colombia. 

I have recently been awarded a two-month residency at the Santa Fe Art Institute in New Mexico, an opportunity for me to focus on the development of a new body of photographic and installation-based work. To attend, I need to cover the costs of the residency fee, transportation, food and art materials, which total 3250.00

As a token of my gratitude, I am offering a perk of professional photographic prints made especially for this fundraiser in exchange for your support.  

Thank you for your help and enthusiasm, and please share this project with others! 


www.jeanpaulgomez.com

story:
Hello - Wayman Humphrey here and I’m super excited about my project that I’m kicking off!! Ok so yes I’m asking for money - but I think we can reach my goal and get this project started on the right foot. So what’s the project? Glad you asked… Wayman Humphrey Art is almost open for business and by helping me fund this project you’ll help further my education as well as get the business off the ground and soon soaring to new heights! A little background about me - I am an artist currently in school studying animation at SCAD - Savannah College of Art & Design. You’d be helping me to further my education and move Wayman Humphrey Art forward with ventures such as story boarding, animation, and graphic design opportunities. 


Woodland Hills Reunion Logo ^^

School Project - Turtle Inks ^^

Art Contest/Giveaway ^^

We currently need $2500.00 for a Wacom monitor to handle the work mentioned above - (maybe a link to the monitor) This monitor is critical to getting work to the clients digitally - and sooner for a much quicker turn around. It’s all about speed in this business!! Compared to the old methods of scanning in the work or snail mailing it - this way immediately inputs the work into digital format and it can be emailed to the client the moment it’s finished.

So make a pledge! Anything you can donate is appreciated. Maybe you’ll score some cool art, and you’ll definitely help an artist, college student, and all-around good guy get one step closer to realizing his dream. Thank you for your support!

story:
Booktilla® is ...

The Booktilla® Bookbox

 

The "Book" that contains and tells Booktilla®

 A precious Box to keep with your precious Books.
The Spine with the title, the Cover, the inside Pages, all BookBox will help you to tell the essence and uniqueness of each version of Booktilla®, allowing customization (see Booktilla® 4Brand).



MEASURES, CAPACITY AND WEIGHT


4 DIFFERENT COLORS, EACH WITH ITS OWN DISTINCT IDENTITY



Choose your Booktilla®!

With Early Special Offer (see Perk in the right column), for each Booktilla® color-version, first 800 copies are available $16 each one (+ shipping cost).




BOOKTILLA® 4BRAND

Customize Booktilla® associating it to your company, your product and event

Express and communicate your Company's identity through Booktilla® and its meanings.
Make Booktilla® the "Water Book" that expresses your Company!
With 4Brand version, you can print whatever you want on one side of Booktilla®.

Regarding the BookBox:
- You can put your title on the Spine of BookBox;
- You can define as you like the Cover;
- You can insert text and image contents that you want, within 4 pages inside BookBox.




ESTIMATED DELIVERY TIME AND SHIPPING COSTS


ESTIMATED DELIVERY TIME: October 2015

Shipping costs




BOOKTILLA® AND INDIEGOGO'S CAMPAIGN


Who we are? Booktilla® is a product designed and developed by Sintegy®. We are a company that deals with enterprise strategic development (strategy, organization, corporate identity, innovation and business development, ...). We believe in companies that - large or small - exist relying on a passion, on the willingness to undertake and engage with dedication and enthusiasm, to provide new and useful products that improve people's lives, stimulating and inspiring them. Our purpose is to contribute to the development of this type of business ... DEVELOPING THE ESSENCE OF ENTERPRISES.
We do this, supporting and directing companies in their development. We also do research with the aim of creating tools and management approaches, source of inspiration and innovation for companies. Through books, training sessions, events, and more, we also want to help to develop a sound corporate culture. Precisely for this reason (and because we like to undertake), we created, as a company, products that are source of inspiration ... Booktilla® wants to be an example in this direction.

Why? Booktilla® is born:
- To help to reduce pollution and waste of resources generated by "disposable" bottles;
- To convert bottle in a design product that, with its different versions, can help to express ourselves;
- To be an example of how each product can be innovated;
- To raise awareness of how important it is to drink water;
- To support initiatives and social innovation projects.

Why support us?
If you think that every single product, even traditional ones, can be subject to important developments and continuous improvement ...
If you think every product is supposed to bring joy and benefit to the people ...
If you think that every product should offer, in some way, an opportunity to support initiatives to improve and make more beautiful the context in which we live ...
If you think it's right to choose those products that contain within themselves important messages and meanings ...
If you think that a product can and should go beyond its basic function, contributing also and above all to create more responsible lifestyles ...
If you think that a product may be an opportunity to help to express yourself and your values ...
... then you have to support Booktilla®.

Booktilla® Story: Booktilla® is the brainchild of Pierluigi Cupri, Strategic Developer and Head of the Development Center for a Social Role of Enterprises and Territory improvement, in Sintegy®.
Noting the inconvenience of half-liter bottles, especially for people who travel with work bag, he thoughts: "Why not create a bottle more convenient, more beautiful and reusable?".
In about a year and a half, the idea has since moved to register the design model (April 2014), the search for partners in line with our values for development and production, materials research, development product and its meanings and values, trademark registration, coming to what today Booktilla® is.
A path that allowed us to explore, to grow and work with beautiful business realities.

Where are we now?We are almost done: for months we have been working with our business partners on the development and production of Booktilla® and, with their help, we have created a first prototype production.

Why Booktilla® on Indiegogo? There are different ways to finance a project. We thought we would do it on Indiegogo, because it gives us the opportunity to raise the necessary resources, allowing us already to promote and to share the values of Booktilla®.



A development that involves excellent enterprises of Made in Italy




GOALS


$10.000 necessary amount to cover the final costs to start producing Booktilla®. 

$30.000 If we reach this goal, we will able to develop additional solutions for improvement, especially with regard to materials and structure of Booktilla® BookBox.  

$80.000 with this milestone, we can start with some research in order to further innovate Booktilla® and to start to support social initiatives. The first ones, that we will undertake, will be in favour of Sport for young people and in favour of new enterprise development.


FUTURE CHALLENGES


We want Booktilla® constitutes SOURCE OFTRIGGERS AND INSPIRATIONS for actions and lifestyles more and more passionate to themselves, the environment, small daily habits, ...
In this regard, it is our intention to allocate part of Booktilla®'s future proceeds to INITIATIVES improvement in favour of different fields, including Health and Sport, world of Art, Environment, Entrepreneurship and new enterprise development.
To share the ideals of Innovation and sound entrepreneurship in which we trust, and which through Booktilla® we want to express, we will continue to take in materials research, development, design, development of cooperation ...
With some prominent figures from the world of sports (and more) and in collaboration with some companies (clothing industry, etc.), we are designing NEW Booktilla® ACCESSORIES in order to make it even more beautiful and useful.




INFO & F.A.Q.


What does it means that Booktilla® is made with antibacterial function materials?
We have chosen to design Booktilla® with an additive antibacterial. In collaboration with MaTech® of the Galileo Park of Padua, we have taken a Research in order to find the most suitable additive. Several studies and investigations show that additives with silver can contribute to the reduction of the bacterial load.

What's the amount of shipping costs? I forgot to add the shipping costs. What to do?
The following table specifies the shipping costs:
 

You can add the postage for all of your perks with a single free contribution. Just type in the postage amount that you can find on shipping costs table. In any case, be sure to use the same account you used for the first contribution(s), so that we'll be able to link them all to you.

Can I freeze water in my Booktilla®?
Sure! But, it is obviously a good idea to not fill full your bottle to the very top before freezing - as water will expand once frozen.

In addition to Black, Green, Blue and Red, Booktilla® is available in other colors?
Not at the moment. The colors of Booktilla (each one with its own name, identity and related initiatives) are the only colors available. In future, however, we will develop other versions of Booktilla®, related to events, or to the world of art, or limited editions, that could provide for other colors.

What is the temperature range of Booktilla®?
The body of Booktilla is made of HDPE, which can withstand temperatures from -50 ° C (-58 ° F) to 110 ° C (230 ° F).

What is estimated delivery time of Booktilla®?

October 2015.


Can I fill Booktilla® with beverages other than water? Of course! In passing from one drink to another, just remember to wash it well, otherwise it could be the taste or smell of earlier drinks.




 

VERSIONE ITALIANA



Booktilla® è ...

Booktilla® Bookbox

 

Il “libro” che contiene e racconta Booktilla®

Una preziosa scatola che puoi conservare e riporre assieme agli altri tuoi libri.
Il dorso con il titolo, la copertina, le pagine interne, tutto della Bookbox contribuirà a raccontare l’essenza e l’unicità di ogni versione di Booktilla®, lasciando inoltre spazio a personalizzazioni (come nel caso di Booktilla® 4Brand).



MISURE, CAPACITÀ E PESO


DISPONIBILE IN 4 DIVERSI COLORI, OGNUNO CON LA SUA IDENTITÀ



Scegli la tua Booktilla®!

Con l’Early Special Offer (vedi i Perk nella colonna a destra), per ogni colore-versione di Booktilla, le prime 800 copie sono disponibili con un’offerta di $16 ciascuna (+ spese di spedizione).




BOOKTILLA® 4BRAND

Personalizza Booktilla® legandola alla tua impresa, a un tuo prodotto o a un evento

Esprimi e comunica l’identità della tua impresa tramite Booktilla e i suoi significati.
Fai diventare Booktilla® il libro dell’acqua che esprime la tua realtà! Con la versione 4Brand, puoi stampare quello che vuoi sulla facciata di Booktilla®.

E nell’ambito della Bookbox:
– puoi inserire il tuo titolo sul dorso della Bookbox;
 – puoi definire a tuo piacimento la copertina;
– puoi inserire i contenuti di testo e di immagine che vuoi nell’ambito delle 4 pagine presenti all’interno della Bookbox.




STIMA DI CONSEGNA E SPESE DI SPEDIZIONE


DATA STIMATA CONSEGNA Ottobre 2015

Costi di spedizione




BOOKTILLA® E LA CAMPAGNA IN INDIEGOGO


Chi Siamo? Booktilla® è un prodotto ideato e sviluppato da Sintegy®. Siamo un’impresa che si occupa di sviluppo strategico dell’impresa (strategia, organizzazione, identità d’impresa, innovazione e sviluppo del business, …).
Crediamo in imprese che – grandi o piccole che siano – esistono fondandosi su una passione, sulla voglia di intraprendere e di impegnarsi con dedizione ed entusiasmo, per offrire prodotti nuovi e utili, che migliorano la vita delle persone, stimolandole e ispirandole. Il nostro scopo è quello di contribuire allo sviluppo di questo tipo di imprese … di SVILUPPARE L’ESSENZA DELLE IMPRESE.
Lo facciamo affiancando e indirizzando le imprese nel loro sviluppo. Facciamo inoltre attività di ricerca con l’intento di dare vita a strumenti e approcci di management fonte di ispirazione e innovazione per le imprese. Attraverso libri, momenti formativi, eventi, … ci proponiamo inoltre di contribuire a sviluppare una sana cultura d’impresa.
Proprio per questo (e perché ci piace intraprendere), diamo vita, come impresa, a prodotti che siano fonte di ispirazione … Booktilla® vuole essere un esempio di questi.

Why? Booktilla® è nata:
– per contribuire a ridurre l’inquinamento e lo spreco di risorse generato dalle bottiglie “usa e getta”;
– per trasformare la bottiglia da imballaggio a un oggetto di design che, con le sue diverse versioni, possa contribuire ad esprimerci;
– perché vuol essere un esempio di come ogni prodotto può essere innovato;
– per sensibilizzare quanto bere acqua sia importante;
– per supportare iniziative e progetti di innovazione sociale.

Perché supportarci?
Se pensi che ogni singolo prodotto, anche tra quelli più tradizionali, possa essere oggetto di importanti evoluzioni e miglioramento continuo…
Se credi che sia responsabilità di ogni prodotto portare gioia e utilità alle persone…
Se pensi che ogni prodotto in qualche modo dovrebbe dare l’opportunità di supportare iniziative per migliorare e rendere più bello il contesto in cui viviamo…
Se pensi che sia giusto scegliere quei prodotti che racchiudono dentro di se importanti messaggi e significati…
Se pensi che un prodotto possa e debba andare oltre la propria funzione di base, contribuendo anche e soprattutto a creare stili di vita più responsabili…
Se pensi che un prodotto possa costituire un’opportunità per contribuire esprimere te stesso e i tuoi valori…

…allora devi supportare Booktilla®.


Booktilla® Story: Booktilla® è nata da un’idea di Pierluigi Cupri, Strategic Developer e Responsabile del Centro di Sviluppo per un Ruolo Sociale dell’impresa e il Miglioramento del Territorio in Sintegy®.
Notando la scomodità delle bottigliette da mezzo litro, soprattutto per chi si muove con la borsa da lavoro, ha pensato: “perché non creare una bottiglia più comoda, più bella e riutilizzabile?”.
In circa un anno e mezzo, l’idea si è poi evoluta con la registrazione del modello di design (aprile 2014), la ricerca di partner in linea con i nostri valori per lo sviluppo e la produzione, ricerche sui materiali, lo sviluppo del prodotto e dei suoi significati e valori, la registrazione del marchio, arrivando a ciò che è oggi è Booktilla®.
Un percorso che ci ha permesso di esplorare, di crescere e di collaborare con bellissime realtà d’impresa.

A che punto siamo?Siamo alle battute finali: da mesi collaboriamo con i nostri partner per lo sviluppo e la produzione di Booktilla® e, con il loro aiuto, abbiamo già dato vita a una prima produzione di prototipi.

Perché Booktilla® su Indiegogo? Diversi possono essere i modi per finanziare un progetto. Noi abbiamo pensato di farlo su Indiegogo, perché ci dà l’opportunità di raccogliere le risorse necessarie, potendo anche già veicolare e condividere i valori alla base di Booktilla®.



Uno sviluppo che coinvolge eccellenti realtà d’impresa del Made in Italy




GOALS


$10.000 quota necessaria per coprire gli ultimi costi per iniziare a produrre Booktilla®. 

$30.000 se raggiungiamo questo traguardo, potremmo sviluppare ulteriori soluzioni migliorative, soprattutto per quanto riguarda materiali e struttura della Bookbox di Booktilla®.  

$80.000 con questo traguardo potremo partire con alcune attività di ricerca per innovare ulteriormente Booktilla® e per iniziare a supportare qualche iniziativa di carattere sociale. Le prime che intraprenderemo saranno a supporto dello Sport per i giovani e a supporto dello sviluppo di nuove imprese.


SFIDE FUTURE


Vogliamo che Booktilla® costituisca FONTE DI STIMOLI E DI ISPIRAZIONI per azioni e stili di vita sempre più attenti a sé stessi, all’ambiente, alle piccole abitudini quotidiane, …

A tal proposito è nostra intenzione in futuro destinare una parte del ricavato di Booktilla® a INIZIATIVE di miglioramento a supporto di diversi campi, tra i quali la Salute e lo Sport, il mondo dell’Arte, l’Ambiente, l’imprenditorialità e lo sviluppo di nuove imprese.

Per condividere gli ideali di INNOVAZIONE e di impresa in cui crediamo, e che anche attraverso Booktilla® vogliamo esprimere, continueremo a intraprendere nella ricerca dei materiali, nello sviluppo del design, nello sviluppo di collaborazioni …

Con alcune importanti figure del mondo dello Sport (e non solo) e in collaborazione con alcune imprese (nel settore dell’abbigliamento, ecc.), stiamo ideando NUOVI ACCESSORI per rendere Booktilla® ancora più bella e utile




INFO & F.A.Q.


Cosa significa che Booktilla® è fatta con materiali con funzione antibatteriche?

Abbiamo scelto di realizzare Booktilla® con un additivo antibatterico. In collaborazione con il Matech® del Galileo Park di Padova, abbiamo effettuato una ricerca per individuare l’additivo più adatto.
Diversi studi e ricerche evidenziano come gli additivi a base di argento possano contribuire alla riduzione della carica batterica.


Come si può pulire Booktilla®?

Il miglior modo per pulire Booktilla è sciacquarla ogni volta prima di riempirla. Booktilla® è comunque lavabile in lavastoviglie.


Quali sono le spese di spedizione? Ho scordato di aggiungere i costi di spedizione. Come faccio?

Nella tabella che segue sono specificate le spese di spedizione:

 

Nel caso ti sia dimenticato, puoi aggiungere i costi di spedizione per tutti i tuoi perk con una sola donazione libera, indicando l’importo totale della spedizione, come specificato nella tabella qui sopra.

Accertati in ogni caso di utilizzare sempre lo stesso account. In questo modo saremo in grado di collegare tutte le donazioni a te.


Posso mettere Booktilla® in congelatore?

Certo, ti consigliamo però di non riempirla fino all’orlo, poiché l’acqua quando diventa ghiaccio assume maggior volume.


Oltre al Nero, Verde, Blue e Rosso, Booktilla® è disponibile in altri colori?

Al momento no. Le colorazioni di Booktilla, ognuna con proprio nome e identità e iniziative collegate, sono le uniche colorazioni disponibile.

In futuro però svilupperemo altre versioni di Booktilla® legate a eventi o al mondo dell’arte o edizioni limitate che potranno prevedere altre colorazioni.


Fino a quali temperature può resistere Booktilla® ?

Il corpo di Booktilla è fatto in HDPE, che può resistere a temperature da -50° C (-58°F) a 110° C (230° F).


Quando verrà consegnata la mia Booktilla®?

La consegna di Booktilla® è prevista per Ottobre 2015.


Posso riempire Booktilla® anche con bevande diverse dall’acqua?

Certo! Nel passare da una bevanda all’altra, ricordati però di lavarla bene, altrimenti potrebbe rimanere il gusto o l’odore delle bevande precedenti.
story_txt:
Booktilla® is ...





The Booktilla® Bookbox
 
The "Book" that contains and tells Booktilla® A precious Box to keep with your precious Books.The Spine with the title, the Cover, the inside Pages, all BookBox will help you to tell the essence and uniqueness of each version of Booktilla®, allowing customization (see Booktilla® 4Brand).

MEASURES, CAPACITY AND WEIGHT

4 DIFFERENT COLORS,
EACH WITH ITS OWN DISTINCT IDENTITY




Choose your Booktilla®!
With Early Special Offer (see Perk in the right column), for each Booktilla® color-version, first 800 copies are available $16 each one (+ shipping cost).
BOOKTILLA® 4BRAND
Customize Booktilla® associating it to your company, your product and event

Express and communicate your Company's identity through Booktilla® and its meanings.

Make Booktilla® the "Water Book" that expresses your Company!

With 4Brand version, you can print whatever you want on one side of Booktilla®.

Regarding the BookBox:

- You can put your title on the Spine of BookBox;

- You can define as you like the Cover;

- You can insert text and image contents that you want, within 4 pages inside BookBox.ESTIMATED DELIVERY TIME AND SHIPPING COSTS
ESTIMATED DELIVERY TIME: October 2015
Shipping costs

BOOKTILLA® AND INDIEGOGO'S CAMPAIGN
Who we are? Booktilla® is a product designed and developed by Sintegy®. We are a company that deals with enterprise strategic development (strategy, organization, corporate identity, innovation and business development, ...).
We believe in companies that - large or small - exist relying on a passion, on the willingness to undertake and engage with dedication and enthusiasm, to provide new and useful products that improve people's lives, stimulating and inspiring them.
Our purpose is to contribute to the development of this type of business ... DEVELOPING THE ESSENCE OF ENTERPRISES.

We do this, supporting and directing companies in their development. We also do research with the aim of creating tools and management approaches, source of inspiration and innovation for companies. Through books, training sessions, events, and more, we also want to help to develop a sound corporate culture.
Precisely for this reason (and because we like to undertake), we created, as a company, products that are source of inspiration ... Booktilla® wants to be an example in this direction.

Why? Booktilla® is born:

- To help to reduce pollution and waste of resources generated by "disposable" bottles;

- To convert bottle in a design product that, with its different versions, can help to express ourselves;

- To be an example of how each product can be innovated;

- To raise awareness of how important it is to drink water;

- To support initiatives and social innovation projects.
Why support us?If you think that every single product, even traditional ones, can be subject to important developments and continuous improvement ...If you think every product is supposed to bring joy and benefit to the people ...If you think that every product should offer, in some way, an opportunity to support initiatives to improve and make more beautiful the context in which we live ...If you think it's right to choose those products that contain within themselves important messages and meanings ...

If you think that a product can and should go beyond its basic function, contributing also and above all to create more responsible lifestyles ...

If you think that a product may be an opportunity to help to express yourself and your values ...

... then you have to support Booktilla®.
Booktilla® Story: Booktilla® is the brainchild of Pierluigi Cupri, Strategic Developer and Head of the Development Center for a Social Role of Enterprises and Territory improvement, in Sintegy®.Noting the inconvenience of half-liter bottles, especially for people who travel with work bag, he thoughts: "Why not create a bottle more convenient, more beautiful and reusable?".
In about a year and a half, the idea has since moved to register the design model (April 2014), the search for partners in line with our values for development and production, materials research, development product and its meanings and values, trademark registration, coming to what today Booktilla® is.
A path that allowed us to explore, to grow and work with beautiful business realities.
Where are we now?We are almost done: for months we have been working with our business partners on the development and production of Booktilla® and, with their help, we have created a first prototype production.
Why Booktilla® on Indiegogo? There are different ways to finance a project. We thought we would do it on Indiegogo, because it gives us the opportunity to raise the necessary resources, allowing us already to promote and to share the values of Booktilla®.A development that involves excellent enterprises of Made in Italy

GOALS
$10.000 necessary amount to cover the final costs to start producing Booktilla®. 

$30.000  If we reach this goal, we will able to develop additional solutions for improvement, especially with regard to materials and structure of Booktilla® BookBox.

 

$80.000  with this milestone, we can start with some research in order to further innovate Booktilla® and to start to support social initiatives. The first ones, that we will undertake, will be in favour of Sport for young people and in favour of new enterprise development.FUTURE CHALLENGES
We want Booktilla® constitutes SOURCE OFTRIGGERS AND INSPIRATIONS for actions and lifestyles more and more passionate to themselves, the environment, small daily habits, ... In this regard, it is our intention to allocate part of Booktilla®'s future proceeds to INITIATIVES improvement in favour of different fields, including Health and Sport, world of Art, Environment, Entrepreneurship and new enterprise development.To share the ideals of Innovation and sound entrepreneurship in which we trust, and which through Booktilla® we want to express, we will continue to take in materials research, development, design, development of cooperation ... With some prominent figures from the world of sports (and more) and in collaboration with some companies (clothing industry, etc.), we are designing NEW Booktilla® ACCESSORIES in order to make it even more beautiful and useful. 

INFO & F.A.Q.What does it means that Booktilla® is made with antibacterial function materials?
We have chosen to design Booktilla® with an additive antibacterial. In collaboration with MaTech® of the Galileo Park of Padua, we have taken a Research in order to find the most suitable additive.

Several studies and investigations show that additives with silver can contribute to the reduction of the bacterial load.
What's the amount of shipping costs? I forgot to add the shipping costs. What to do?
The following table specifies the shipping costs: 
You can add the postage for all of your perks with a single free contribution. Just type in the postage amount that you can find on shipping costs table.

In any case, be sure to use the same account you used for the first contribution(s), so that we'll be able to link them all to you.
Can I freeze water in my Booktilla®?
Sure! But, it is obviously a good idea to not fill full your bottle to the very top before freezing - as water will expand once frozen. In addition to Black, Green, Blue and Red, Booktilla® is available in other colors?
Not at the moment. The colors of Booktilla (each one with its own name, identity and related initiatives) are the only colors available.

In future, however, we will develop other versions of Booktilla®, related to events, or to the world of art, or limited editions, that could provide for other colors.What is the temperature range of Booktilla®?
The body of Booktilla is made of HDPE, which can withstand temperatures from -50 ° C (-58 ° F) to 110 ° C (230 ° F). What is estimated delivery time of Booktilla®?October 2015.
Can I fill Booktilla® with beverages other than water?

Of course! In passing from one drink to another, just remember to wash it well, otherwise it could be the taste or smell of earlier drinks. 


VERSIONE ITALIANA


Booktilla® è ...





Booktilla® Bookbox
 
Il “libro” che contiene e racconta Booktilla®Una preziosa scatola che puoi conservare e riporre assieme agli altri tuoi libri.

Il dorso con il titolo, la copertina, le pagine interne, tutto della Bookbox contribuirà a raccontare l’essenza e l’unicità di ogni versione di Booktilla®, lasciando inoltre spazio a personalizzazioni (come nel caso di Booktilla® 4Brand).

MISURE, CAPACITÀ E PESO

DISPONIBILE IN 4 DIVERSI COLORI,
OGNUNO CON LA SUA IDENTITÀ




Scegli la tua Booktilla®!
Con l’Early Special Offer (vedi i Perk nella colonna a destra), per ogni colore-versione di Booktilla, le prime 800 copie sono disponibili con un’offerta di $16 ciascuna (+ spese di spedizione).
BOOKTILLA® 4BRAND
Personalizza Booktilla® legandola alla tua impresa, a un tuo prodotto o a un evento



Esprimi e comunica l’identità della tua impresa tramite Booktilla e i suoi significati.

Fai diventare Booktilla® il libro dell’acqua che esprime la tua realtà!

 

Con la versione 4Brand, puoi stampare quello che vuoi sulla facciata di Booktilla®.

E nell’ambito della Bookbox:

– puoi inserire il tuo titolo sul dorso della Bookbox; – puoi definire a tuo piacimento la copertina;

– puoi inserire i contenuti di testo e di immagine che vuoi nell’ambito delle 4 pagine presenti all’interno della Bookbox.STIMA DI CONSEGNA E SPESE DI SPEDIZIONE
DATA STIMATA CONSEGNA Ottobre 2015
Costi di spedizione

BOOKTILLA® E LA CAMPAGNA IN INDIEGOGO
Chi Siamo? Booktilla® è un prodotto ideato e sviluppato da Sintegy®. Siamo un’impresa che si occupa di sviluppo strategico dell’impresa (strategia, organizzazione, identità d’impresa, innovazione e sviluppo del business, …).
Crediamo in imprese che – grandi o piccole che siano –  esistono fondandosi su una passione, sulla voglia di intraprendere e di impegnarsi con dedizione ed entusiasmo, per offrire prodotti nuovi e utili, che migliorano la vita delle persone, stimolandole e ispirandole.
Il nostro scopo è quello di contribuire allo sviluppo di questo tipo di imprese … di SVILUPPARE L’ESSENZA DELLE IMPRESE.

Lo facciamo affiancando e indirizzando le imprese nel loro sviluppo. Facciamo inoltre attività di ricerca con l’intento di dare vita a strumenti e approcci di management fonte di ispirazione e innovazione per le imprese. Attraverso libri, momenti formativi, eventi, … ci proponiamo inoltre di contribuire a sviluppare una sana cultura d’impresa.Proprio per questo (e perché ci piace intraprendere), diamo vita, come impresa, a prodotti che siano fonte di ispirazione … Booktilla® vuole essere un esempio di questi.

Why? Booktilla® è nata:

– per contribuire a ridurre l’inquinamento e lo spreco di risorse generato dalle bottiglie “usa e getta”;

– per trasformare la bottiglia da imballaggio a un oggetto di design che, con le sue diverse versioni, possa contribuire ad esprimerci;

– perché vuol essere un esempio di come ogni prodotto può essere innovato;– per sensibilizzare quanto bere acqua sia importante;

– per supportare iniziative e progetti di innovazione sociale.
Perché supportarci?Se pensi che ogni singolo prodotto, anche tra quelli più tradizionali, possa essere oggetto di importanti evoluzioni e miglioramento continuo…

Se credi che sia responsabilità di ogni prodotto portare gioia e utilità alle persone…

Se pensi che ogni prodotto in qualche modo dovrebbe dare l’opportunità di supportare iniziative per migliorare e rendere più bello il contesto in cui viviamo…

Se pensi che sia giusto scegliere quei prodotti che racchiudono dentro di se importanti messaggi e significati…

Se pensi che un prodotto possa e debba andare oltre la propria funzione di base, contribuendo anche e soprattutto a creare stili di vita più responsabili…

Se pensi che un prodotto possa costituire un’opportunità per contribuire esprimere te stesso e i tuoi valori…

…allora devi supportare Booktilla®.

Booktilla® Story: Booktilla® è nata da un’idea di Pierluigi Cupri, Strategic Developer e Responsabile del Centro di Sviluppo per un Ruolo Sociale dell’impresa e il Miglioramento del Territorio in Sintegy®.Notando la scomodità delle bottigliette da mezzo litro, soprattutto per chi si muove con la borsa da lavoro, ha pensato: “perché non creare una bottiglia più comoda, più bella e riutilizzabile?”.
In circa un anno e mezzo, l’idea si è poi evoluta con la registrazione del modello di design (aprile 2014), la ricerca di partner in linea con i nostri valori per lo sviluppo e la produzione, ricerche sui materiali, lo sviluppo del prodotto e dei suoi significati e valori, la registrazione del marchio, arrivando a ciò che è oggi è Booktilla®.
Un percorso che ci ha permesso di esplorare, di crescere e di collaborare con bellissime realtà d’impresa.
A che punto siamo?Siamo alle battute finali: da mesi collaboriamo con i nostri partner per lo sviluppo e la produzione di Booktilla® e, con il loro aiuto, abbiamo già dato vita a una prima produzione di prototipi.
Perché Booktilla® su Indiegogo? Diversi possono essere i modi per finanziare un progetto. Noi abbiamo pensato di farlo su Indiegogo, perché ci dà l’opportunità di raccogliere le risorse necessarie, potendo anche già veicolare e condividere i valori alla base di Booktilla®.Uno sviluppo che coinvolge eccellenti realtà d’impresa del Made in Italy

GOALS
$10.000 quota necessaria per coprire gli ultimi costi per iniziare a produrre Booktilla®. 

$30.000 se raggiungiamo questo traguardo, potremmo sviluppare ulteriori 
soluzioni migliorative, soprattutto per quanto riguarda materiali e struttura della Bookbox di Booktilla®.

 

$80.000  con questo traguardo potremo partire con alcune attività di ricerca per innovare ulteriormente Booktilla® e per iniziare a supportare qualche iniziativa di carattere sociale. Le prime che intraprenderemo saranno a 
supporto dello Sport per i giovani e a supporto dello sviluppo di nuove imprese.SFIDE FUTURE
Vogliamo che Booktilla® costituisca FONTE DI STIMOLI E DI ISPIRAZIONI per azioni e stili di vita sempre più attenti a sé stessi, all’ambiente, alle piccole abitudini quotidiane, …
A tal proposito è nostra intenzione in futuro destinare una parte del ricavato di Booktilla® a INIZIATIVE di miglioramento a supporto di diversi campi, tra i quali la Salute e lo Sport, il mondo dell’Arte, l’Ambiente, l’imprenditorialità e lo sviluppo di nuove imprese.
Per condividere gli ideali di INNOVAZIONE e di impresa in cui crediamo, e che anche attraverso Booktilla® vogliamo esprimere, continueremo a intraprendere nella ricerca dei materiali, nello sviluppo del design, nello sviluppo di collaborazioni …
Con alcune importanti figure del mondo dello Sport (e non solo) e in collaborazione con alcune imprese (nel settore dell’abbigliamento, ecc.), stiamo ideando NUOVI ACCESSORI per rendere Booktilla® ancora più bella e utile 

INFO & F.A.Q.Cosa significa che Booktilla® è fatta con materiali con funzione antibatteriche?Abbiamo scelto di realizzare Booktilla® con un additivo antibatterico. In collaborazione con il Matech® del Galileo Park di Padova, abbiamo effettuato una ricerca per individuare l’additivo più adatto.Diversi studi e ricerche evidenziano come gli additivi a base di argento possano contribuire alla riduzione della carica batterica.
Come si può pulire Booktilla®?Il miglior modo per pulire Booktilla è sciacquarla ogni volta prima di riempirla. Booktilla® è comunque lavabile in lavastoviglie.
Quali sono le spese di spedizione? Ho scordato di aggiungere i costi di spedizione. Come faccio?Nella tabella che segue sono specificate le spese di spedizione: 

Nel caso ti sia dimenticato, puoi aggiungere i costi di spedizione per tutti i tuoi perk con una sola donazione libera, indicando l’importo totale della spedizione, come specificato nella tabella qui sopra.
Accertati in ogni caso di utilizzare sempre lo stesso account. In questo modo saremo in grado di collegare tutte le donazioni a
 te.
Posso mettere Booktilla® in congelatore?
Certo, ti consigliamo però di non riempirla fino all’orlo, poiché l’acqua quando diventa ghiaccio assume maggior volume.
Oltre al Nero, Verde, Blue e Rosso, Booktilla® è disponibile in altri colori?Al momento no. Le colorazioni di Booktilla, ognuna con proprio nome e identità e iniziative collegate, sono le uniche colorazioni disponibile.
In futuro però svilupperemo altre versioni di Booktilla® legate a eventi o al mondo dell’arte o edizioni limitate che potranno prevedere altre colorazioni.
Fino a quali temperature può resistere Booktilla® ?Il corpo di Booktilla è fatto in HDPE, che può resistere a temperature da -50° C (-58°F) a 110° C (230° F).

Quando verrà consegnata la mia Booktilla®?La consegna di Booktilla® è prevista per Ottobre 2015.

Posso riempire Booktilla® anche con bevande diverse dall’acqua?Certo! Nel passare da una bevanda all’altra, ricordati però di lavarla bene, altrimenti potrebbe rimanere il gusto o l’odore 
delle bevande precedenti.

story:
Study For Sturtevant Voice (Cover Version)

is my graduation project at the Sandberg Instituut (Fine Arts) in Amsterdam.

It is a continuation of my investigations, conducted while two years of study program, on auto/biography and the self as fictional constructs. It is a reflection and substantiation of both the qualities of voice/speech as well as artistic practice and persona of American artist Elaine Sturtevant. It originates from her understanding of repetition as conceptual idea that has greately pushed the limitation of resemblance "holding the higher powers of non-identity and difference".

Sturtevant "reproducing" the works of other artists she performed the gestures of others. In act of recreation and repetition I have been learning her voice - adapting it to my own. The purpose is not only to mimic but uderstand and reproduce its qualities. The evidence of this proces (journey) will articulate its "visibilities" in a form of recording registered on a LP record.  

I am rising fundings to produce the edition of the 12" vinyl records (which will be released on the 19th of June on the ocassion of exhibition at Rongwrong and San Serriffe in Amsterdam).

The covers (like the prototype on the picture) will be made by hand, using the technique of marbling paper, which makes each copy unique.

I would be extremely happy if this campaign helped me to realize my dream and make the work available for the wider public.

Thank You! *

story:
Every donation receives a code to download my newest instrumental album, Catalyst, to be the soundtrack for your own artistic endeavors, along with opportunities to receive a postcard of one of the existing soundscape paintings or a newly created smaller painting on unstretched canvas. (Hear a track from Catalyst and view current soundscape paintings in the above video)

The reward paintings are unstretched partly for shipping's sake, but also so that you may do whatever you wish with them! Book covers, pillows, bags, a patch for those pants you ripped, etc. You can even cut them up and I shall not be offended. On one condition: picture proof. ;)

This series of paintings, titled Resonance, is a recent breakthrough in my visual release. For the first time in my life, I feel that I have found a cohesive series that is in line with the depths of my soul, interests and desires. The inspiration for these paintings is drawn from sound, galaxies, and the contrast of attention to detail yet free-form release.

Many of you lovely individuals have expressed your excitement for these paintings and how they are developing, and that you wish you could support their progress financially. I completely sympathize that in our post-grad life and tight-budget economy, $100+ is quite the investment for a work of art. Also, many individuals have expressed that they would love to see these paintings go BIG (5x5').

So, I thought it would be a good idea to put together a little crowd-funding project, where as much as you desire may be donated with rewards in return, and you can know that every penny is going to bring these paintings a larger life.

Where did the $500 goal come from?

A breakdown of supplies to go BIG:

  • 60" Stretcher bars = $40 per painting
  • 6yd roll of 72" wide canvas = $70
  • Paint = approx. $60 (large bottles of primary colors, metallics, and black)
  • Large brushes = $20 (set of four sizes)
  • Staple gun = $15

*Approximately $200 in initial supplies + $50 each painting after*

I can make three 5x5' paintings out of the canvas roll I already purchased, so this first attempt is roughly a $300 project purely supplies-wise.

My goal is to make at least five large paintings while continuing to make smaller, more affordable and space-friendly pieces, leading me to the $500 approximation.

This project is unlike anything I've embarked on before, so I am very excited and grateful for all of the support you have given thus far and continue to provide!

So much love, Jessi.

story: Calling all cosplayers! If you live in California or have attended a convention or gathering in California in 2010 or 2011, California Cosplay Adventures Magazine needs you! This is just an idea, but I am trying to put together a quarterly (4 issues per year) magazine, and I need submissions! This includes conventions, private photo shoots, and even Halloween costumes! I also need people to write tutorials for costuming, wigs, preparing for an artist alley booth, and preparing for a convention! And of course, con-reports are a big part of this, as there are MANY conventions in California! Pictures of yourself with Voice Actors and other celebrities would be great too, whether you are in costume or not! There will eventually be a section for "Featured Cosplayer," cosplay theme issues, and maybe even a contest or two!

story:
Our Story   

Life is about Texture.

Art is about Telling Stories.                                                                                                                                                  

My name is Rebecca Roxanne Quattrone, Campaign Owner and Director of the Busy Bee Mosaic Project by Children with Visual Impairments: An Installation Created by Children Documenting their Stories with their Unique Vision Condition.

 

I embark on this venture because I believe the mosaic art form has the innate ability to help us see the world anew, creating a rich conversation between ourselves, others and the world around us. I believe art teaches us so much because it inspires us to stretch our hearts and minds. This belief embodies everything I do, whether itâ€™s creating mosaics sculptures, teaching my college students, working with the community as a public artist or serving as the artist-in-residence at the ForSight Vision Center in York, PA. My passion is to inspire the next generation of artists.

 

The inspiration for this project began through my experience working with children at the ForSight Vision Center and has made me aware that the term â€œblindâ€ does not sufficiently communicate the many different and challenging levels of vision impairment. I learned a great deal about vision loss, low vision or visual impairment and hope to convey a more comprehensive understanding of what it means to be visually impaired while emphasizing the beautiful truth that vision impairment does not mean these children do not â€œseeâ€. I have witnessed firsthand the amazing sight and perspectives these children have and want to afford them an audience to experience their story. To that end, this project will introduce the children to the rich, tactile, and colorful world of mosaics while providing them with a creative platform and outlet that allows them to document and express their distinctive stories with their specific vision condition. I believe the nature of the mosaic art process and materials used are highly adaptive to suit each childâ€™s specific vision condition, which will yield an amazing expression of creativity.                          

                                                     

I, along with my team, will initially launch the project at the ForSight Vision Center of York. Each childâ€™s story will be captured in their own honeycomb cell that will be incorporated into a larger collective mosaic in the form of a â€œBee Hive".  The larger mosaic will then be permanently installed in the main lobby of the ForSight Vision Center. The sculptural "Busy Bee" metaphor embodies the spirit and energy of the ForSight children housed within the projective "hive" of the vision center. 

 

The Impact

This project will immediately and most powerfully affect the children by providing them with a platform and creative outlet to express themselves without boundaries or impediments in a supportive and nurturing environment. This collaborative project will also impact the children's siblings, parents, and family members by providing them with a support system based on the "shared" experiences with their children. The larger reaching impact will help promote awareness in the community regarding the achievements of people with visual impairments.

 

After achieving this vision, I hope to bring this approach to other visually impaired children throughout all the Vision Centers in Pennsylvania. With each project residency, I will add the children's individual pieces (tesserae) to my traveling gallery collection in the spirit of the nationally acclaimed â€œAIDS Quilt Project,â€ which honors and memorializes those lost to AIDS, as well as, the â€œEyes Wide Openâ€ project which honors our fallen servicemen and women. These traveling projects, such as the "Busy Bee Mosaic Project", are based upon unique objects that represent a specific person and their journey.

 

My team will produce a video documentary of the children's creative processes, as well as their familyâ€™s journeys with their children. The creation and installation of mosaic projects within each vision center will enable others to â€œseeâ€ as our children â€œseeâ€ in their own distinctive voices.

 

What We Need & What You Get 

Your donations will allow the Busy Bee Mosaic Team to purchase the basic mosaic materials, i.e., stone, tile, adhesives, glass, mirror, grout, sealer, the site-specific installation materials, and the video documentation. Funds raised above the target goal will allow the team to travel to one or more of the 28 Pennsylvania affiliated visions centers to share this approach/creative process with other visually impaired children.  My training and experience in the art of mosaics (American and Byzantine traditions) will allow me to adapt the "Busy Bee Hive" design by adjusting the scale, if only a portion of the projected goal is met. All the funds raised will be directly applied to the childrenâ€™s mosaic projects within the area.  Your contribution will allow provide the children a memorable and rewarding experience while providing you with unique project-based perks!

 

Other Ways You Can Help                                                         

Please help spread the word by becoming a "Busy Bee". You can help create a "Buzz" by sharing our project mission with your family, friends and neighbors by sharing our URL: https://indiegogo.com/busybeemosaic via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc.

 

This funding will create a unique and powerful tactile metaphor that will allow all to â€œseeâ€ into the worlds of visually impaired children.
story_txt:
Our Story   
Life is about Texture.
Art is about Telling Stories.                                                            
                                                                                     

My name is Rebecca Roxanne Quattrone, Campaign Owner
and Director of the Busy Bee Mosaic Project by Children with Visual
Impairments: An Installation Created by Children Documenting their Stories with
their Unique Vision Condition. 
 
I embark on this venture because I believe the
mosaic art form has the innate ability to help us see the world anew, creating
a rich conversation between ourselves, others and the world around us. I
believe art teaches us so much because it inspires us to stretch our hearts and
minds. This belief embodies everything I do, whether itâ€™s creating mosaics
sculptures, teaching my college students, working with the community as a
public artist or serving as the artist-in-residence at the ForSight Vision
Center in York, PA. My passion is to inspire the next generation of artists.
 
The inspiration for this project began through my
experience working with children at the ForSight Vision Center and has made me
aware that the term â€œblindâ€ does not sufficiently communicate the many different
and challenging levels of vision impairment. I learned a great deal about
vision loss, low vision or visual impairment and hope to convey a more
comprehensive understanding of what it means to be visually impaired while
emphasizing the beautiful truth that vision impairment does not mean these
children do not â€œseeâ€. I have witnessed firsthand the amazing sight and
perspectives these children have and want to afford them an audience to
experience their story. To that end, this project will introduce the
children to the rich, tactile, and colorful world of mosaics while providing
them with a creative platform and outlet that allows them to
document and express their distinctive stories with their specific
vision condition. I believe the
nature of the mosaic art process and materials used are highly adaptive
to suit each childâ€™s specific vision condition, which will yield an amazing
expression of creativity.                          
                                                     

I, along with my team, will initially launch the
project at the ForSight Vision Center of York. Each childâ€™s story will be
captured in their own honeycomb cell that will be incorporated into a larger
collective mosaic in the form of a â€œBee Hive".  The larger mosaic
will then be permanently installed in the main lobby of the ForSight Vision
Center. The sculptural "Busy Bee" metaphor embodies the spirit and
energy of the ForSight children housed within the projective "hive"
of the vision center. 
 
The
Impact
This project will immediately and most powerfully affect
the children by providing them with a platform and creative outlet to express
themselves without boundaries or impediments in a supportive and nurturing
environment. This collaborative project will also impact the children's
siblings, parents, and family members by providing them with a support system
based on the "shared" experiences with their children. The larger
reaching impact will help promote awareness in the community regarding the
achievements of people with visual impairments.
 
After achieving this vision, I hope to bring this
approach to other visually impaired children throughout all the Vision Centers
in Pennsylvania. With each project residency, I will add the children's individual pieces (tesserae)
to my traveling gallery collection in the spirit of the nationally acclaimed
â€œAIDS Quilt Project,â€ which honors and memorializes those lost to AIDS, as well
as, the â€œEyes Wide Openâ€ project which honors our fallen servicemen and women.
These traveling projects, such as the "Busy Bee Mosaic Project", are
based upon unique objects that represent a specific person and their journey. 
 
My team will produce a video documentary of the
children's creative processes, as well as their familyâ€™s journeys with their
children. The creation and installation of mosaic projects within each vision
center will enable others to â€œseeâ€ as our children â€œseeâ€ in their own
distinctive voices. 
 
What We Need & What You Get  
Your donations will allow the Busy Bee Mosaic Team to purchase
the basic mosaic materials, i.e., stone, tile, adhesives, glass, mirror, grout,
sealer, the site-specific installation materials, and the video documentation.
Funds raised above the target goal will allow the team to travel to one or more
of the 28 Pennsylvania affiliated visions centers to share this
approach/creative process with other visually impaired children.  My training and experience in the art of
mosaics (American and Byzantine traditions) will allow me to adapt the
"Busy Bee Hive" design by adjusting the scale, if only a portion of
the projected goal is met. All the funds raised will be directly applied to the
childrenâ€™s mosaic projects within the area. 
Your contribution will allow provide the children a memorable and
rewarding experience while providing you with unique project-based perks! 
 
Other Ways You Can
Help                                  
                      
Please help spread the word by becoming a "Busy
Bee". You can help create a "Buzz" by sharing our project
mission with your family, friends and neighbors by sharing our URL:
https://indiegogo.com/busybeemosaic via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc.
 
This funding will create a unique and powerful
tactile metaphor that will allow all to â€œseeâ€ into the worlds of
visually impaired children.

story:
My Story

Hi!   My name is Tracy Ellis-Maxwell and I'm an artist...and an animal lover. www.4pawspetart.com

I work with several animal rescue groups in the Kansas City area. 


Currently, I'm painting several murals inside a new low cost spay/neuter clinic in Riverside Missouri, on behalf of NAWS (Northland Animal Welfare Society). www.pcnaws.org  

The new clinic opens on Feb 14th and will provide a much needed service to that area of the city.


The murals will be painted in phases, with the first phase being the lobby entrance and hallway leading to the rest of the clinic. This phase will include two long murals (over 14 feet each) and a couple of smaller murals in the waiting area.


What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking for pets to paint into these murals. Specifically, up to 10 Large or Medium sized dogs, plus up to 15 cats and/or small dogs.


I am donating my time, supplies, and services to create these murals, so this project will allow me to recoup some of those costs, as well as cover my mileage, since it's a 60 mile round trip each time I go paint. 


The Rewards:


For a $5 contribution, you will receive:

    a Thank You note from me on a post card featuring a section of a mural.


For a $15 contribution, you will receive:

   a Thank You note from me on a post card featuring a section of a mural,

   and a 3" round magnet featuring a section of a mural


For a $35 contribution, you will receive:

   a Thank You note from me on a post card featuring a section of a mural,

   and a 3" round magnet featuring a section of a mural,

   plus YOUR cat or small dog painted into one of the murals


For a $55 contribution, you will receive:

   a Thank You note from me on a post card featuring a section of a mural,

   and a 3" round magnet featuring a section of a mural,

   plus YOUR Large or Medium sized dog painted into one of the murals


* Obviously, the paintings won't be as detailed as the portraits on my web site, though you will be able to recognize your pet, which I will duplicate as close as possible to the picture you provide.


I am looking for full body pictures of pets standing, sitting, reclining or jumping. I will also need a couple of Large or Medium head shots as well, for two places in the mural.


So please sign up and send your pet's photo as soon as possible. The clinic opens on the 14th and I need to have all artwork completed at least the day before.


Thanks!


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, family, Facebook Peeps, etc.

Check out NAWS website and how cool they are and how they help the community. www.pcnaws.org

Start going through your pet photos (or taking new photos) to get ready for Phase 2 (extending into the building)
